conversations.content: What section of the BMW E30 M3 documentation does this favicon represent?
This favicon represents the favicon section of the BMW E30 M3 documentation.
What is the purpose of this roller assembly in the gearbox?
It serves as the main shaft roller assembly with inner sleeve and outer race components.
What special coating should be used on exhaust manifold screw connections?
Molykote HSC compound coat.
What is the torque specification for the control pipe to bypass valve/turbocharger?
The control pipe to bypass valve/turbocharger (9AZ) requires 30 Nm of torque using M30 threading.
What material does the component housing appear to be made from?
The housing appears to be made from cast aluminum, based on its metallic appearance and casting marks.
What is the screw size and torque specification for the bypass valve to flow section?
The bypass valve to flow section (2AZ) uses M30 threading with M8 screws and requires 25 Nm of torque.
What size screws are used for the transfer box on automatic transmission?
M8 screws with a torque specification of 23 Nm.
Which fuel injector specification applies to all vehicle types?
The fuel injector to intake manifold specification (1AZ) applies to all vehicle types.
What can be seen underneath the gear components in the second image?
Service manual pages or documentation can be seen spread out underneath the gear components, likely being used as reference material during the rebuild process.
What should be inspected when cleaning transmission housing surfaces?
When cleaning, inspect for cracks in the casting, damaged threads in mounting holes, and ensure all passages are clear of debris.
What type of bearing or bushing is visible at the top of the differential shaft?
A bearing race or bushing is visible at the top of the differential shaft where it extends through the housing.
What visual indicator helps identify the input shaft?
The rings around the shaft help identify it as the input shaft.
What issue was encountered during the shimming process for reverse gear?
Shimming for reverse was dodgy with too thin a shim in there.
What is the torque value for M30/S14/S38 B 35 engine vibration damper hub screws?
For M30/S14/S38 B 35 engines, the vibration damper hub uses M24 x 1.5 screws torqued to 440 Nm.
What type of bearing configuration is shown in this assembly?
This appears to be a ball bearing with multiple steel balls visible in the bearing race assembly.
What are the applicable conditions for shaft screws according to DIN 13?
Only applicable to shaft screws with metric standard and fine threads according to DIN 13, sheet 13 and nuts with height of 0.8 x d according to DIN 934 and only for a Âµ total = 0.125.
Which connection point requires the higher torque specification?
The bracket to body connection requires the higher torque at 15 Nm
What component appears to have splined internal surfaces in the disassembled parts?
The sync hub component on the left has splined internal surfaces.
What cleaning challenge was encountered with the gearbox components?
Everything inside the box was covered in black grime and required lots of work to clean it all off.
What type of transmission case is shown in the top image?
A Getrag transmission case is shown, as evidenced by the visible Getrag casting marks on the aluminum housing.
What alternative parts source is mentioned for synchronizer rings?
New OEM syncs supplied by Pelican Parts that looked identical in every way to the ones removed and a lot cheaper than the BMW OEM items.
What size screw is used for the ASS 560Z component and what torque is required?
The ASS 560Z component uses M8 screws with a torque specification of 23 Nm.
What sealant should be used when installing studs during the retorque procedure?
Molykote HSC
Which component has different torque specifications between E31 and other models?
The shift arm console to body connection has different torque values: 21 Nm for all except E31, and 9 Nm for E31.
For the aluminum propeller shaft flexible disk on propeller shaft for E39, what screw type and torque are specified?
The aluminum propeller shaft flexible disk on propeller shaft for E39 uses M12 10.9 screws torqued to 100 Nm.
What was the author's comment about the complexity of the work?
The author stated it was 'Enough to drive anyone to drink,' indicating the complexity and challenging nature of the transmission rebuild process.
What is the torque specification for S38 B36 engine vibration damper?
The S38 B36 engine vibration damper requires an initial torque of 150 Nm.
What is the torque specification for the reinforcement plate to transmission mounting?
23 Nm (ft. lbs.) using M8 screws
What can be seen in the first photograph showing the differential assembly?
The first photograph shows a differential assembly with splined components and what appears to be internal gearing, along with some small hardware parts on a striped cloth.
Which component uses both M8 and M10 screws according to the table?
All three components listed use both M8 and M10 screws: rubber mount to front axle carrier, rubber mount to engine console, and engine console to engine.
What was checked during the gearbox disassembly process?
Every shimmed item in the gearbox was checked for correctness at disassembly with the old bearings.
How many different components are listed under the Case and Cover section?
Two components: 16AZ (Holder to transfer case) and 17AZ (Retaining plates for bearings on housing).
Which section of the fuel system does this page cover?
This page covers section 13-10 Fuel System, specifically 13 80 Gas-powered units.
What is the final step after heating and clamping the component?
The final step is to press the heated component off the shaft.
Where do the 'C' plates clamp during the removal procedure?
The 'C' plates clamp around the flange.
What workspace setup is shown in the image?
The image shows a clean workbench with newspaper laid out to protect the surface, with transmission components organized and spread out for disassembly work.
What is the initial torque specification for cylinder head bolts on the 7AZ engine?
The initial torque specification for cylinder head bolts on the 7AZ engine is 30 Nm.
What component is covered under section 24 40?
Section 24 40 covers the Torque converter.
What is the complete description of component 1AZ?
Fan clutch on water pump, Coupling nut (left-hand threads)
What material appears to be used for the construction of this transmission housing?
The transmission housing appears to be constructed from cast aluminum, evident from its silver metallic appearance and casting characteristics.
What is the procedure before retorquing the M21 engine bolts?
Loosen bolt first before retorquing to 12 Nm.
What does the caption indicate about the bearing installation?
The caption indicates that a new genuine bearing is going on, suggesting this is part of an installation procedure.
What are the three engine suspension components listed in this torque specification table?
1AZ - Rubber mount to front axle carrier, 2AZ - Rubber mount to engine console, and 3AZ - Engine console to engine
What tool or container is visible in the background?
A small container or bottle with black and white labeling is visible in the background.
What is the significance of this component's cost relative to other gearbox parts?
It is identified as the single most expensive part for the gearbox.
What size screw is used for oil pipes to turbocharger?
M8 screw with 22 Nm torque specification.
What alternative part was used to resolve the reverse shimming problem?
A shim from a classic Mini suspension ball joint was used to resolve the reverse shimming issue.
What type of component is shown in the center of the image?
The component shown in the center is a wheel bearing, identifiable by its double-row ball bearing design and BMW part numbering.
What is the overall shape of the component housing?
The component housing has an irregularly shaped casting with a circular upper flange and a more rectangular lower section.
What three categories of components are being compared in this transmission rebuild?
Gear, Old Syncros, and New Syncros.
Which components are covered under section 11 42?
Oil Filter and Pipes components are covered under section 11 42.
According to the text, what makes this gearbox component particularly expensive?
This is described as the single most expensive part for the gearbox enough to make your eyes water.
What is the overall condition assessment of the transmission components shown?
Most components appear to be in good condition with bearings intact, but there is significant damage to one of the input shaft shims that was cracked.
What part number is visible on the aluminum housing component?
The part number 202.0.06300 is visible stamped on the aluminum housing.
What challenge does the tight press fit create during service?
The tight press fit makes disassembly a bit nerve-racking and requires special tools like a puller and heat to remove components.
What does this component's condition indicate about the transmission's maintenance history?
The presence of black grime everywhere suggests potential maintenance issues or contamination despite apparently clean oil.
What parts were purchased prior to disassembly besides syncro rings and springs?
Gaskets/seals were purchased prior to disassembly, along with the syncro rings and springs.
What component needs to be removed along with the shift rod when removing the reverse gear loose and 1st reverse synchro hub?
The 1st reverse synchro hub which has to be removed as an assembly along with the shift rod by sliding it out along the out put shaft.
What type of fasteners are used for the oil pan on engine block with 12 Nm torque?
M6 10.9 fasteners are used for the oil pan on engine block with 12 Nm torque.
What torque specification applies to the governor housing to hub fastener?
11 Nm with M6 screw size for the 4 HP-22 H type.
What is the highest torque value listed in this fuel injection components table?
The highest torque value listed is 80 Nm for the injection nozzle combination assembly (1AZ).
What page identifier is shown for this torque specifications page?
The page identifier shown is bmwtorquespecs-001.
What engine types use M51 specification for the temperature sensor to water flange?
M51 engines use 13 Nm torque specification
What is the visual appearance of the main component in the image?
It appears as a polished metallic cylindrical shaft with a bearing assembly and ring.
What transmission components are shown disassembled on the white cloth?
A transmission input shaft with gear teeth is shown lying on the white cloth, along with other transmission parts.
How long should you wait before retightening the wiper arms to their final torque specification?
You should wait for 15 minutes before retightening the wiper arms to their final torque specification.
What two documentation methods are recommended before seal removal?
Both photographing and measuring where the seals sit are recommended before removal.
What did the author do to the seal area?
The author polished the seal area and all the shift rods where they go through bushes.
What transmission types are specifically mentioned in the Type column?
All, A4S 270R/A4S 310R, and 4HP-22/4HP-24.
What specific difficulty does the 2nd 3rd hub roll pin present during removal?
It is tricky to remove because it basically hammers down the gap between the gear teeth, making access difficult.
What screw size and torque value is specified for A4S 270R/A4S 310R/A5S 310Z/A5S 300J/A5S 440Z/A5S 560Z transmission types?
These transmission types use M10 screws torqued to 45 Nm.
What is the item code for the catalytic converter on silencer?
The catalytic converter on silencer is item 4AZ.
What assumption is made about torque wrenches according to this specification?
This presupposes that the torque wrenches required for this are subjected to a regular inspection.
What packaging materials are visible around the bearing?
The bearing is surrounded by cardboard packaging material and appears to have protective wrapping, along with various BMW parts labels and documentation.
What is the surface condition of the bearing race?
The bearing race appears clean and polished, consistent with a new genuine bearing.
What indicates this is a transmission disassembly procedure?
The presence of transmission shafts, gear assemblies, roll pins, and the systematic removal and organization of internal transmission components.
What measurement is shown on the digital calipers in the image?
The digital calipers display a measurement of 1.194 mm.
What is the main category this torque specification falls under?
12 - 15 Engine Electrical Equipment
How many different governor components are listed in this torque specification table?

Five different governor components are listed: governor flange to transmission, stud in centrifugal governor, hexagon nut on stud, hexagon head screw on centrifugal governor, and governor housing to hub.
What characteristic of the original shim made it unsuitable for reverse gear?
The original shim was too thin for proper shimming of reverse gear.
What screw size is used for the transmission cross member to body connection?
M10 screws are used for the transmission cross member to body connection.
What was challenging about this particular removal step?
It required 4.5 tons of force to get it moving and there was concern about breaking the gear teeth during the process.
What is the predominant color scheme used in this favicon design?
The predominant color scheme consists of BMW's traditional colors with blue and red diagonal stripes on a black background.
What color is the service equipment visible in the background?
Yellow service equipment or tooling is visible in the background of the workshop.
What was the result regarding tooth damage during the removal?
The mechanic was really glad no teeth were broken and had a few goes at it just hoping the teeth did not break off.
What does the author mean by 'enough to drive anyone to drink'?
This is a humorous reference to the complexity and frustration involved in keeping track of all the transmission components during disassembly and cleaning.
What vehicle models does this torque specifications section cover?
This torque specifications section covers the BMW E30 M3 and 320is models.
What is the highest torque specification shown for M14x1.5 thread screws?
240 Nm (ft. lbs.) for M14x1.5 12.9
Which component uses M22 x 1.5 screws according to this specification table?
The oil drain plug (1AZ) uses M22 x 1.5 screws with a torque specification of 60 Nm.
What problem occurred with the second gear that led to the bearing being 'loose'?
Getting 2nd gear off managed to 'loose' a ball bearing from the syncro hub never to be found again.
What transmission component is visible on the white cloth in the top image?
A transmission shaft with gear teeth is visible lying on the white cloth.
How are the transmission components organized in the bottom image?
The transmission components are laid out in an organized manner showing the disassembled transmission case with gears and shift mechanisms separated.
Which transfer box component requires the largest screw size?
The coupling to manual transmission and transfer box requires M12 screws, which is the largest size listed.
Which has a lower torque specification: the drain plug or the expansion tank mounting?
The drain plug at 2.5 Nm is lower than the expansion tank mounting at 9 Nm.
What caution is given regarding Poltex brake linings?
On systems with Poltex brake linings, increased braking effect.
What transmission type uses the governor housing to hub specification?
4 HP-22 H transmission type.
What should be added to the windshield washer fluid if necessary?
Fill with antifreeze additive if necessary
What is the torque value for installing the spray nozzle to tailgate?
10 Nm for E34 touring models.
How many different torque values are specified for the trailer hitch installation?
Three different torque values: 42 Nm, 59 Nm, and 220 Nm
How many different torque values are specified for interior shift elements?
Three different torque values: 22 Nm, 35 Nm, and 25 Nm
What is the difference in torque between the ground connections flange nut and the cover on heating splash wall?
14.9 Nm difference (16 Nm - 1.1 Nm).
How much torque is required for the plug to hydraulic plunger?
60 Nm with M36x1 screw
What section and subsection does this clutch disc and drive plate information belong to?
21-2 Clutch, subsection 21 21 Clutch disc and drive plate
How much torque should be applied to an M18 10.9 screw?
390 Nm (ft. lbs.)
What lubrication is specified for door hinges and hood hinges?
Lubricate door hinges and hood hinges with oil, and lubricate door locks with grease and check their function.
What is the torque specification for oil line hollow bolts on all transmissions?
The hollow bolts for oil lines on transmission should be tightened to 37 Nm using M16 x 1.5 threads.
What size screws are used for the reinforcement plate to transmission connection?
M8 screws.
Do all the shift mechanism components listed apply to all vehicle types?
Yes, all components listed show 'All' in the Type column
What section of the manual covers Interior Shift Components?
Section 23 31
What torque is specified for the adjustable shift rod clamp on E31 models?
23 Nm for E31 models.
What is the tightening torque for an M18x1.5 8.8 screw?
313 Nm (ft. lbs.)
Which Loctite product should be used with the slotted nut for the take-up pipe to hitch?
Loctite No. 638
What torque specification applies to both the charge tract and oil return flange connections?
22 Nm using M8 screws for both connections.
What torque specification applies to all transmission types for the reverse gear shaft to case with M10 screws?
45 Nm using M10 screws.
What special instruction is given for one of the torque steps?
Unfasten screw one half turn
What is the torque value for the control unit holder in E box?
5 Nm (ft. lbs.)
What is the thread specification for the lock nut?
What special note is mentioned for the oil pressure switch installation?
Note: oil and screw in
What is the highest torque specification shown in the transmission mounts table?
42 Nm for the support tube to engine subframe on E36 models
What is the torque specification for the increment wheel on crankshaft?
M5 10.9 screw with 13 Nm (ft. lbs.) torque specification.
What should be checked regarding the central locking system?
Check operation of central locking system.
What procedure is mentioned for the S14/S38 B36 application?
Replace bolt and taper sleeve
What torque should be applied to the oil temperature sensor?
13 Nm for S38/S50 type
What type of oil should be used according to the important instructions?
Use approved oil only!
Which transmission types use M22 screws for the plug in rear casing section?
260/280 transmission types use M22 screws with 60 Nm torque.
What is the difference in torque specification between M8 8.8 and M8 10.9 screws for the clutch disc and drive plate?
M8 10.9 screws require 34 Nm while M8 8.8 screws require 24 Nm, a difference of 10 Nm.
What is the torque specification for vacuum pump mounting screws that are labeled as 1AZ?
M6 screw: 10 Nm
What BMW standard should be referenced for the applicable range of tightening torques?
What DIN standard applies to shaft screws with metric standard and fine threads according to this specification?
DIN 13, sheet 13 and nuts with height of 0.8 x d acc. to DIN 934
Which component has the lowest torque specification in the glow plug section?
The wire to glow plug (3AZ) has the lowest torque specification at 4 Nm
What section of the manual covers transmission extension, bearings, and seals?
Section 24 13 - Transmission Extension, Bearings, Seals

Screw-in fittings on transmission use both M14x1.5 and M16x1.5 threads and should be tightened to 37 Nm.
What section of the manual covers exhaust manifold specifications?
Section 11-34 Engine, specifically subsection 11 62 for Exhaust manifold.
What lighting components should be tested for proper function?
Check function of cigar lighter and check function of headlight cleaners.
What is the torque specification for the converter bell housing?
25 Nm with M8 screw for all models.
Where can service information for windshield washing system maintenance be found?
Service information can be found in Group 00 (Gr. 00).
What is the torque specification for the vacuum pump on cylinder head for all engine types?
10 Nm using M6 screws.
What section of the manual covers these wire to starter specifications?
Section 12-10 Engine Electrical Equipment, subsection 12 42 Wires to starter.

The coupling nut requires 25 Nm while the fuel injector to manifold requires 10 Nm, a difference of 15 Nm.
What is the torque specification for the temperature switch (5.5Â°C / 17Â°C) to fuel filter/cylinder head?
18 Nm with M21 threads
What component requires a 15 Nm torque specification according to this page?
Temperature switch for electronic box (1AZ)
What is the difference in torque angle between S38 and S50 connecting rod bolts?
The S50 requires 65Â° while the S38 requires 60Â°, a difference of 5Â°
How much more torque is required for the bracket to body connection compared to the telescope to bracket?
12 Nm more (15 Nm - 3 Nm = 12 Nm)
What are the identification codes for the components listed under Interior Shift Elements?
1AZ for shift segment to shaft and 2AZ for detent spring on shift unit
What is the Order Number for the adapter used with the SI-R?
Order No. 62 1 140
What is the difference in screw size between the general vacuum pump mounting and the M51/M41 specific mounting?
The general mounting uses M6 screws while M51/M41 engines use M8 screws.
How much torque should be applied to the temperature switch (3AZ)?
28 Nm for all engine types.
Are the pipes to engine oil cooler specifications the same for all vehicle types?
Yes, it applies to all vehicle types with a torque of 28 Nm
Which transmission mount connections use M8 screws?
The mount bracket to transmission connection uses M8 screws.
What torque should be applied when connecting the fuel vapor venting tank to body on an E30?
4.5 Nm (ft. lbs.)
What torque specification applies to M52 engines with cast aluminum engine blocks?
40 Nm initial torque, followed by two 90Â° torque angles
What transmission component should be leak tested on 325 iX models only?
The final drive (front axle transfer case 325 iX only) should be leak tested.
What components should have their nuts and bolts tightened during this inspection?
Steering, brake calipers and wheel bolts should have their nuts and bolts tightened.
What type of specifications are contained in this section?
This section contains tightening torques specifications for various components.
What component is identified as 1AZ in the oil pressure, oil temperature, oil level display system?
Oil-pressure switch/oil-temperature switch
What type of fastener is used for securing the headlight cleaner components?
E36 type screws
When should the exhaust manifold bolts be loosened first during the retorque procedure?
After 2000 km, loosen bolt first, then install studs with Molykote HSC
What is the document identifier shown at the top of this page?
AZD13-12.frb

Group reference Gr. 12/32/64 covers checking all drive belts and adjusting tension if necessary.

Fan clutch on water pump coupling nut

Toothed belt pulley to intermediate shaft, Type M20/M21, Screw M10, Measure 60 Nm
Which transmission types use the retaining plates for bearings on housing specification?
S 5 D 310 Z/S 5 D 200 G/250 G transmissions.
What is the reference code 1AZ referring to in this specification table?
1AZ refers to the Torque converter to flywheel specification.

Manual transmission connection requires 42 Nm while automatic transmission connection requires 23 Nm, a difference of 19 Nm.

Section 11-40 Engine, subsection 11 81 Engine Suspension

Visual inspection for correct installation, routing, damage or leaks.
What screw size is used for the A4S 270R/A4S 310R valve body to transmission connection?
5/16" screws.

Section 13-2, Fuel delivery and metering system, subsection 13 31 Fuel Pump with Drive and Pipes

18 Nm for M21/M51 engine types.

Nm (Newton meters)
What torque specification should I use for an M4 10.9 fastener?
4.1 Nm (ft. lbs.)

Support tube to engine subframe, rubber mounts to carrier pipe, and carrier plate

Shift arms to transmission case
What is the torque specification for the upper cowl panel support?
5 Nm (ft. lbs.) using M4 screws with type E31.
What screw thread specification is used for both the plug and cylinder for chain tensioner components?
Both components use M22 x 1.5 and M26 x 1.5 thread specifications respectively, depending on the specific application.

BMW Annual Check corresponds to inspection code 240.
What types of thread specifications are covered in this torque table?
M12 thread and M12x1.5 thread
What BMW standard should I refer to for the applicable range of tightening torques?
What units are used for the torque measurements in the headlight cleaner specifications?
Nm (Newton-meters)
What section of the manual is this page from?
This page is from section 11-11 Engine, specifically subsection 11 13 Oil Pan.
What is the torque specification for ignition coil terminal 1?
3.0 Nm (ft. lbs.)
What torque should be applied to an M14x1.5 8.8 thread fastener?
143 Nm (ft. lbs.)

After introduction of: Operating-Fluids-File is noted at the bottom with an asterisk reference.
What is the range of torque values for the engine electrical equipment plug connectors and terminals?
The torque values range from 1.1 Nm to 16 Nm.
What type of threads does the fan clutch coupling nut have?
Left-hand threads
Which section of the manual covers external shift linkage specifications?
Section 24 51 - External shift linkage
Which section of the manual covers water pump and drive specifications?
Section 11 51

Check the power steering system for leaks and oil level, correcting if necessary.

The lock nut has a higher torque specification at 21 Nm compared to the brake band adjusting screw at 5 Nm
What happens when you push and hold the red INSPECTION button during service indicator reset?
When you push and hold the recessed, red INSPECTION button, a green lamp (function control) comes on.
What component is being torqued according to specification 1AZ in the wire harness and shift elements section?
Transmission socket to case.
What is the difference in torque specifications between the engine oil cooler to body and the vapor extraction guide connections?
The engine oil cooler to body requires 14 Nm while the vapor extraction guide to trim panel requires only 4 Nm.

M4 screws require 1.2 Nm while M5 screws require 1.6 Nm

22 Nm for M8 screws
What is the lowest torque specification shown in this manual transmission torque table?
9 Nm for the screws on detent plate (item 15AZ).
What is the document reference number shown at the top of this page?
AZD13-10.frb

The cap nut on air intake tube at 30 Nm

The A 4 S 270 R/A 4 S 310 R transmission models use the brake band adjusting screw.
What engine types use M70/S70/M73 cylinder head bolts?
7AZ engines
What screw size and torque is specified for SWF wiper components?
M8 screw with 27 Nm (ft. lbs.) torque.
What torque should be applied to the bypass valve to flow section?
25 Nm using M8 screws for M30 type.
How does the torque specification differ between A5S 310Z applications for the guide plate/parking lock mechanism versus the pressure regulator?
The guide plate/parking lock mechanism requires 10 Nm, while the pressure regulator to valve housing requires 5 Nm with M6 screw

The transmission mounts (rubber) to body and transmission cross member to body both require the higher torque of 42 Nm.

Output flange collar nut
What components are covered under reference 3AZ in this specification table?
Oil filter housing and lines on crankcase
What type of screw is used for the bracket of ITS head airbag on body?
Self-tapping screw
Which group references are shown for automatic transmission oil service information?
Group references Gr. 00 and Gr. 24 are shown for automatic transmission oil service information.
What section of the manual covers the preheating relay specifications?
Section 12-5 Engine Electrical Equipment, item 12 21 Preheating Relay
What is the difference in torque between M16x1.5 10.9 and M16x1.5 12.9 bolts?
The difference is 61 Nm (364 Nm for 12.9 minus 303 Nm for 10.9).

The difference is 42 Nm (45 Nm for support frame minus 3 Nm for filler connections holder)

4.5 Nm (ft. lbs.) for the E30

DIN 13, sheet 13 for shaft screws with metric standard and fine threads, and DIN 934 for nuts with height of 0.8 x d.
What units are used for all the torque measurements in this table?
All torque measurements are specified in Nm (Newton-meters)

Check the car for rattling and squeaking noise as part of the pre-delivery inspection.

The A5S 300J transmission with M14x1.5 screws at 35 Nm
What applications use the M8 10.9 34 Nm specification for clutch disc and drive plate?
All applications and specifically S14/S38 B36
What torque specification applies to M14x1.5 12.9 grade bolts?
240 Nm (ft. lbs.)

What bolt sizes are specified for the connecting rod bolts that require replace, wash and oil conrod bolts procedure?
What is the maximum tightening torque for an M12 12.9 screw?
140 Nm (ft. lbs.)
What group reference is associated with the windshield washing system inspection?
Group reference Gr. 00 is associated with the windshield washing system inspection.
What torque specification is used for the angle impulse sensor on cylinder head?
5.0 Nm (ft. lbs.)
What torque should be applied to the ribbed drive belt pulley (3AZ)?
60 Nm (ft. lbs.)
Which group reference is provided for checking engine, clutch, transmission, and rear axle functions?
Group reference Gr. 34 is provided for checking function of engine, clutch, transmission, rear axle, steering, and braking in parking brake.
Which engine types use the higher torque specification of 34 Nm for vibration damper installation?
S38 B36 and S38 B 38 engines both use 34 Nm torque specification.
What is the torque specification for screws on detent plate?
9 Nm for transmission type ZF S-5-16/5 S D 310 Z.
What screw size is specified for microencapsulated vacuum pump bolts?
M9 screws.
What is the procedure number for removing and installing the pulley on the crankshaft?
The procedure number is 11 21 120 for removing and installing pulley on crankshaft.
What is the proper tightening procedure for the oil filter after the gasket bears on the surface?
Tighten the oil filter by hand until the gasket bears on the surface, then tighten the filter by hand one half turn more.
What is the sequence for installing the lockplate and bolt after sprocket installation?
Install lockplate and bolt down the sprocket with tightening torque of 9 + 1 Nm (6.5 + 0.5 ft. lbs.).
What should be done with the O-rings during installation?
Replace O-ring (2) in oil bore and check O-rings (3), replacing if necessary.
What is the tightening torque specification for the fan installation?
The tightening torque is 40 + 10 Nm (29 + 7 ft. lbs.) which equals a 30 Nm (22 ft. lbs.) setting on the torque wrench.
What critical warning is given about cranking the engine after timing chain removal?
Caution! Never crank the engine after removing the timing chain.
How should bearing play be measured and corrected?

Read bearing play by measuring the width of the flattened Plastisage with help of the supplied scale. Correct bearing play by installing new bearing shells of different machined size or with different color code.
What should be done with the gaskets during installation?
Gaskets should be checked and replaced if necessary during installation.
How should the conically wound end of the spring be positioned during installation?
The conically wound end of spring faces plug (1).
What is the procedure for handling the ignition lead and plugs?
Pull ignition lead (1) off of ignition coil, pull off plugs (2 and 3), unscrew nut (4) and place electric lead on opposite end of engine.
How do you install spring 9 and washer 10?
Press in spring 9 and washer 10 with a wrench socket and install circlip 11.
What is the first step in the valve removal process after the cylinder head is removed?
Unscrew spark plugs and mount cylinder head on Special Tool 11 1 065 with Special Tools 11 1 054.
How should the starting motor be operated during the compression test?
Press down accelerator pedal and operate starting motor so long, until compression no longer rises.
What is the procedure reference number for grinding cylinder head sealing surface?
The procedure reference is 11 12 719.
What is the minimum distance 'A' that the friction surface may be machined to?
The minimum distance A = 29.1 - 0.1 mm (1.146 - 0.004").
What are the two different diameters available for Special Tool 11 1 200?
Special Tool 11 1 200 has two diameters - for 7 and 8 mm (0.275 and 0.315 in.) valve stem seals.
What is the maximum permissible tilt play for the intake valve when checking valve guide wear?
The maximum permissible tilt play for the intake valve is 0.65 mm (0.025").
What should you do with the heater hose clamp after loosening it?
Loosen hose clamp (2) and pull off heater hose.
What is the maximum allowable deviation between cylinder compression values?
The value of all cylinders should not deviate by more than 0.5 bar (7 psi).
What is the sequence for removing components from the intake manifold support?

First pull off vacuum hose (1) and pull it out of the intake manifold support, then pull off plug (2), lift out rubber holder (3), place idle speed control aside, and take the engine wire harness out of the holders.
What does the 'BMW M Power' marking visible in the diagrams indicate?
The 'BMW M Power' marking indicates this is the M3's high-performance S14 engine cylinder head cover.
What components need to be removed from the ignition lead tube?
Unscrew nuts (1) on ignition lead tube and pull off spark plug connectors.
What special tool is used for the power steering pump drive belt?
Special Tool 11 5 020 is used to tighten the power steering pump drive belt and check its tightness.
What specific hoses need to be loosened and pulled off according to the top section?
Loosen hose clamp (1) and hose clamp for intake hose (next to radiator), then pull off hoses. Also pull off plugs (2 and 3) and place leads aside.
What is the section number for removing and installing the cylinder head cover?
Section 11 12 000 covers removing and installing the cylinder head cover.
What tool should be used to break the upper edges of the timing case cover?
A file should be used to break the upper edges of the timing case cover.
What external accessories are visible on the engine?
External accessories visible include the alternator, various hoses, the oil pan, and mounting brackets.
What should be inspected on the impeller during water pump overhaul?
Check impeller (3), replacing if necessary during the overhaul process.
What special tool is needed to tighten the drive belt and check tightness for both the power steering pump and air conditioner compressor?
Special Tool 11 5 021.
What are the two types of bearing shells identified in the diagram?
Bearing shell 1-2-4-5 (standard main bearings) and Bearing shell 3 (pilot bearing).
What special tools are needed to drive in the pilot bearing during crankshaft installation?
Special Tools 11 2 030 and 00 5 500 are needed to drive in the pilot bearing.
What sealant is specified for coating sealing surfaces?
Coat sealing surfaces with Three Bond 12 07.
What component is labeled as 'E' in the lower diagram?
Component 'E' appears to be part of the timing chain assembly in the installation diagram.
What should you check during installation of the cylinder head cover?
Check gaskets, replacing if necessary.
What additional step must be performed when installing an oversize valve?
The valve seat must then also be machined - see 11 12 607.
What needs to be removed from the vacuum hose of the pressure regulator?
Pull off plugs (1 and 2), pull vacuum hose (3) off the pressure regulator, and unscrew screw (4) to take off the lead with holder.
What lubrication is specified for the valve stem seal during installation?
Lubricate valve stem seal (2) with oil and install.
What tool combination is used to hold the camshaft in TDC position during installation?
Mount Special Tool 11 3 010 on timing case, hold camshaft in TDC position with Special Tool 11 3 020 and turn shaft up to the arrest - camshaft is held down for installation of bearing caps.
How many arrows are pointing to nuts in the top image?
Multiple arrows are pointing to various nuts marked with (1) around the perimeter of the cylinder head cover.
What special tool is needed to turn the crankshaft to position cylinder no. 1 to TDC?
Special Tool 11 3 020 is needed to turn the crankshaft to position cylinder no. 1 to TDC - cylinder no. 4 overlaps.
Where can you source Special Tool Sleeves according to the manual?
Source for Special Tool Sleeves: CARTOOL, Alfred Brehm Str. 5, D - 8070 Ingolstadt.
What component is identified by callout number (2)?
Callout number (2) identifies the hose clamp that needs to be loosened.
What is the tightening torque specification for the intake manifold nuts?
The tightening torque for the intake manifold nuts is 9 Nm (6.5 ft. lbs.).
What is the maximum allowable axial runout for the flywheel?
Maximum 0.1 mm (0.004").
What should be done with the ground strap mentioned in the procedure?
Unscrew nut (3) and take off the ground strap.
How long should you wait between Step 2 and Step 3 of cylinder head bolt tightening?
Wait 15 minutes between Step 2 and Step 3.
What section should be referenced for removing the water pump?
Section 11 51 000 should be referenced for removing the water pump.
What is the first step when replacing the radial oil seal in the clutch end cover with transmission removed?
Remove the flywheel - see 11 22 000, then drain the engine oil and loosen the oil pan.
What components are identified by callout numbers 1 and 2 in the exhaust manifold diagram?
Callout 1 indicates the connector to unscrew, and callout 2 shows the plug opening with bolt, which is a copper bolt from the M 30 exhaust manifold.
How many bolts secure the distributor rotor and what else needs to be unscrewed?
The distributor rotor is secured by 4 bolts, and the adapter also needs to be unscrewed (5 bolts).
What inspection should be performed during installation of the cylinder head cover?
Check gaskets, replacing if necessary.
What is the first step mentioned for disconnecting components from the oil filter housing?
Disconnect both oil cooler hoses on the oil filter housing.
Which pin number corresponds to the oil level static connection?
Pin 2 corresponds to the oil level static connection with green/yellow wire colors.
What indicates a short in the starter during testing?
When you turn on lights and they go out while starting.
How should the clamping jaws be positioned when using Special Tool 12 1 091?
Move clamping jaws together by turning screw against stop.
What is the procedure section number for replacing and checking the distributor rotor?
The procedure section number is 12 11 111.
If the oscillograph and harmonic wave ratio check shows 'not okay', what should be done?
Replace or disassemble alternator and inspect components.
What should you lubricate during installation of the pull rod?
Lubricate eye of pull rod with grease.
Where should the ammeter be connected to check primary current?
Connect the ammeter in the power supply lead (terminal 15/green, on plug for engine wire harness).
What components need to be checked for the electric fuel pump system?
Check electric fuel pump, fuel pipes, pressure regulator and fuel pressure.
What color wire is used for the speed signal?
Black wire is used for the TD (Speed signal).
What two main systems are covered in this troubleshooting section?
Engine electric and DME (Digital Motor Electronics) are the two main systems covered in this troubleshooting section.
What components must be verified as okay in the starting system before testing?
Starting system okay (battery charged, starting motor and ignition lock).
What should be installed after testing the sender?
Install shielded connector.
What should you do to perform test steps A through D?
Perform test steps A through D according to procedures printed on the simulator.
What should I check first if the starter does not work at all?

Bridge connections 30 and 50 on solenoid. If starter works, check for faulty wires and connections on starter switch or starter switch faulty. If starter does not work, turn on lights to further diagnose.
What are the three numbered components shown in the solenoid switch diagram?
Component 1 is the solenoid switch, component 2 is the spring, and component 3 is the armature.
What should be checked on the slip rings during installation?
Check slip rings for wear. If necessary, remove rotor and fine grind as well as polish the slip rings as part of Pos. 12 31 201.
What is the final step when placing a connection with pliers?
Place the connection flush with pliers and press on to complete the installation.
How do you remove the drive pinion from the shaft?
Push back bearing race (1) with a piece of suitable pipe, pry circlip (2) apart and pull it off of the shaft, then remove burrs with a file.
What are the two steps required to remove the distributor according to step 30 12 018?
Loosen nut, then pull out distributor.
What special tool is required to remove the pulley and fan from the alternator?
Special Tool 12 31 000 is required to remove the pulley and fan.
What two ignition systems are covered in these working instructions?
The instructions cover working on Transistorized Coil-Type Ignition (TCI) and Digital Motor Electronics (DME).
What is the arrangement shown in the washer diagram?
The diagram shows the proper arrangement of washers in sequence from largest to smallest.
What should you do before removing the carbon brushes?
Remove voltage regulator 12 32 000 and unsolder leads on carbon brush holder.
What are the three relays shown in the relay survey for the M20 engine?
The three relays are: 1 Master relay, 2 Fuel pump relay, and 3 Oxygen sensor relay.
What is the purpose of this engine electric/electronic brief test list?
This brief test list refers to important points which are required for correct function of the engine electric/electronics.
What tightening specification is mentioned for the installation?
Tightening torque is specified but refers to see specifications section for the actual value.
What additional step is required for 1986 models and later when removing the starter?
Since 1986 Models: Disconnect plugs for reference mark sensor B (gray) and speed sensor D.

The relays are located behind the trim panel and include: 1) Fuel pump relay, 2) Master relay, and 3) Tank venting relay.
What should be checked on the distributor rotor during inspection?
Check resistance in distributor rotor. Check casting compound for cracks and burns.
What step is required after draining coolant during starter installation?
Pour in coolant and bleed cooling system per procedure 17 00 039.
What three relays are shown in the relay box image?
Relay 1 for fuel pump, Relay 2 for DME, and Relay 3 for oxygen sensor heating.
What tool is recommended for stripping insulation on ignition leads?
Insulation stripping pliers are recommended for stripping insulation on ignition lead after cutting off the old lead contact.

Observe oscillograph - ignition voltage and ignition voltage deviation must agree with nominal values.
Where should the indicator be located on the scale when checking belt tension?
Indicator must be located in scale above the green or yellow field.
What type of circlip should be used during installation?
Use new circlip (2).

Connect test leads for diode test, hold negative lead on cooler and positive lead on one of the negative diode connections.
Which cylinder number's ignition lead shielded plug needs to be pulled off on M 20 engines?
Cylinder no. 6 on M 20 engines.
What is the final outcome when all tests pass successfully?
Ignition system is okay!
What reference number should you check for ignition coil resistance testing?
See 12 13 009 for checking ignition coil resistance of primary and secondary coils.
What test lead is mentioned for the universal adapter?
The universal adapter uses a 35-pin test lead for testing the DME control unit.
What should you do with the vacuum hose when checking ignition timing?
Pull off vacuum hose for advance control.
What tool is specified for checking the drive belt tightness?
Check tightness of drive belt with tester 11 5 020, adjusting if necessary.
What type of supply is needed for pin maintenance?
Grease is needed to lubricate pin (3) during installation.

Signal shown in the figure should be displayed. Only the shape is important when evaluating the signal - not the amplitude height.
What should I do if oscillograph and harmonic wave ratio are not okay?
Replace or disassemble alternator and inspect components.
What action should be taken if the power flow and ground check is okay?
Replace pulse sensor - see 12 11 151.
What is component number 1 in the engine electric layout?
Component number 1 is the Engine wire harness plug.
How should the voltage regulator be installed according to the installation instructions?
Mount regulator at first with one bolt screwed in finger tight, then press alternator to final installed position carefully, install and tighten all bolts.
What should be inspected on the armature shaft?
Inspect armature shaft, removing burrs if necessary, and take off cover.
What component is labeled as 'A' in the electrical testing diagram?
Component 'A' in the diagram shows the solenoid being tested with 12V power.
What component is labeled as (1) in the seal inspection step 30 12 019?
Component (1) is the seal that should be checked and replaced if necessary during installation.
What is the temperature threshold that distinguishes between cold and warm engine starting problems?
The temperature threshold is 20Â°C (68Â°F). Below this temperature, it's considered a cold engine problem, and above this temperature, it's considered a warm engine problem.
Which pins are used to test the final stage of fuel injectors for cylinder 2-4-6?
Pins 17 / 14 are used to test the final stage of fuel injectors for cyl. 2-4-6 (M 20).
What should be sprayed with lubricant if necessary during spark plug connector installation?
Spray with lubricant (12 1 098) if necessary during the installation process.
Which terminal numbers are connected to the positive connections in both diagrams?
Terminals 15 and 30 are connected to the positive connections in both diagrams.
What should the nominal value display be for the rotor coil ground contact test?
â display 999 k-ohms.
What is the specific requirement when replacing spark plugs?
Replace spark plugs but only install specified types.
What type of distributor rotor should not be used for radio and communication equipment shielding?
Do not use a 5 k-ohm distributor rotor for the shielding of radio and/or communication equipment.
What corrective action should be taken if the tests up to these points are okay?
Replace DME control unit, if tests up to this point are okay.
What wire color and size is used for terminal 86 in the Oxygen Sensor Relay?
Terminal 86 in the Oxygen Sensor Relay uses green/white wire with size 0.5 mmÂ².
What section should you reference for checking wire connections for oxidation and good contact?
See section 12 11 091 / 111.
What section provides information about nominal value microfiche?
See Nominal Value Microfiche according to the footnote reference.
What should you check for after machining the commutator?
Check for shorted turns after machining.
How do you test if the one-way clutch is functioning properly?
Turn drive pinion against stop. Pinion will be very easy to turn, if the one-way clutch is worn.
What is the required resistance from the distributor peak to the corresponding contact in the distributor cap?
The resistance must be approximately 0 ohm.
What should be done with a new bearing before installation?
Lubricate new bearing with grease and press in.
What is the maximum allowable slip ring out of true measurement?
The maximum slip ring out of true is 0.03 mm (0.012").
What should you do after removing the holder and pole housing?
Unsolder or cut off all carbon brushes after removing the holder and pole housing.

You should measure voltage with ignition ON > 10 V on pin 37 to ground (19) for power supply for control unit.

Excessive heat from the soldering iron would destroy the diodes.
What should never be connected to term. 1 of the ignition coil?
Never connect a shielded capacitor or test lamp on term. 1 of the ignition coil.
How should the distributor rotor be positioned during installation according to step 30 12 020?
Turn distributor rotor clockwise toward mark on housing approximately 30Â° (A), then insert distributor.
What should you do with the coolant when removing the starter?
Drain coolant and disconnect heater hose, unscrewing coolant pipe if necessary.
What is the purpose of the holding circuit in the Motronic system?
The holding circuit makes sure that the Motronic master relay remains activated for another 3 sec. after switching off ignition lock terminal 15 and stopping the engine.
What should be done with the coolant during installation?
Pour in coolant. Bleed cooling system - see 17 00 039.
What wire color is connected to terminal 30 in the Oxygen Sensor Relay?
Terminal 30 in the Oxygen Sensor Relay is connected to a green/white wire.
What should you do with the engine when testing the pulse sender signal?
Crank engine with the starting motor. The illustrated signal should appear in the oscilloscope screen.
What is the minimum tear-out force specification for the completed connection?
The tear-out force must be â¥ 200 N / 44 lbs when tested by hand.
What must be installed before checking ignition timing?
A TDC transmitter must be plugged in before checking ignition timing.
What is shown in the diagram labeled M 21 12 036?
The diagram shows the measurement setup for checking slip ring out of true with a dial indicator.

Connect universal adaptor on DME control unit and wire harness with 55-pin connecting leads.
If the voltmeter does not display at least 9 volts during the air conditioner speed check, what should be done?
Check blue/white wire for breaks with ohmmeter (M 06) and eliminate breaks.

Remove fuel injectors separately after pushing up the injection pipe until they are lifted out of the guide on the intake manifold.
What tool is used to measure the resistance of the idle control valve?
An ohmmeter (M 06) is used to measure the resistance of the idle control valve.
What is the second voltage test in the idle control unit checking procedure?
Connect voltmeter (M 01) between terminal 2 and terminal 4 with ignition turned on. The voltmeter should display at least 9 volts.
What are the numbered callouts in the installation diagram?
Callout 1 indicates the code number and callout 2 indicates the manufacturing date that should be checked.
What should you do if the code number check and resistance check fail?
Replace cold start valve.
Which pin handles the activation of the oxygen sensor relay?
Pin 21 handles the activation of oxygen sensor relay and oxygen sensor heating.
Where can I find the pressure test procedure for the fuel system?
See Group 13, Position 13 31 029 for the pressure test procedure.
What is the procedure for shortening the push rod for 1st and 2nd cylinders?
Shorten the push rod for 1st and 2nd cylinders until the dial gage needle begins to move. Both throttle levers must bear uniformly on the idle stop.

Item 1 is the electrical plug connection and item 2 is the fuel line connection on the cold start valve.

At least 9 volts.
Where can additional application information be found?
See application information on next page.
What tool should be mounted with holder for the dial gauge adjustment?
Mount dial gage with holder and have dial gage bear with preload on operating lever for 3rd and 4th cylinders.

There will be resistance of approximately 0 ohms between plug connections 1 and 2.

Voltage supply and ground of idle speed control unit okay!
What is the nominal idle speed specification mentioned in the important note?
What happens after you bridge the relay terminals and press the button during pressure testing?
After bridging terminals 87 and 30 and pressing the button, the fuel pump runs and you can check the delivery pressure.
What is the first diagnostic step for fuel pressure too low?
Check fuel feed line routing and flow.
Which terminals provide ground for the fuel injectors?
Ground from term. 12, 14, 15 and 24 (different depending on control unit).
What special tools are needed for checking between the feed pipe and hose?
Install Special Tools 13 3 060 and 13 3 064 between feed pipe and hose.
What should you do if there are breaks in the green wire during the speed signal test?
Eliminate the breaks in the green wire.

Unscrew rubber mounts (1 ... 3) on air flow sensor - there are 3 rubber mounts total.
How do you remove the fuel injectors from the throttle valve necks?
Push up injection pipe (3) until fuel injectors are lifted out of guides on throttle valve necks.

Check for tight fit, good contact of plug connections, and correct level of coolant.

State of plug connections - 0 = disconnected, 1 = connected
What reference number is shown for the throttle switch illustration?
The reference number shown is 30 13 456.
What should you check during installation of the throttle valve switch?
Check the code number (1) and adjust the throttle valve switch - see 13 63 544.
What does plug connection B) represent when both positions are 0 + 0?
Unleaded regular grade ECE

Pull off the plug on the fuel pump, connect a voltmeter (M 1) between the wires in the plug, start the engine, and check that the voltmeter shows battery voltage.

Connect voltmeter (M 01) between terminal 4 and terminal 9, turn on ignition, turn on air conditioner, and check if voltmeter displays at least 9 volts.

Check the code number and manufacturing date, then replace the air flow sensor if needed.
What does callout number 5 indicate in the installation procedure?
Callout number 5 indicates the plug receptacle that should be checked for proper color coding during installation.

What measuring glass is specified for checking fuel flow rate and spray angle?
Measuring glass 13 3 020.
What additional information is referenced at the bottom of the page?
There is a reference to "See Specifications" indicated by an asterisk.
What bolts need to be unscrewed to lift off the injection pipe?
Unscrew bolts (9 and 10). Lift off injection pipe with fuel injectors.
What should the ohmmeter read when checking the ground connection of the control relay?
Connect ohmmeter (M 06) between conn. 31 on disconnected control relay plug and ground. Ohmmeter should display approx. 0 ohm.

Between terminal 4 and terminal 7
What emission test requirement is mentioned before making CO adjustments?

What should be checked during installation of throttle valve necks?
Check O-rings (6), replacing if necessary. Replace hose (7) between manifold and crankcase.
What is the nominal idle speed for cars with automatic transmission after selecting a drive range?
750 Â± 50 rpm
How do I test the power supply between conn. 30 on the disconnected control relay plug and ground?
Connect voltmeter (M 01) between conn. 30 on disconnected control relay plug and ground. Voltmeter must display battery voltage.

Special Tool 13 1 011 is required to remove cap (1) for CO level correction.
What should you reference for plug connections?
See the wiring diagram for plug connections.
What is the complete switching points code number for the throttle switch?
The complete switching points code number is 13 63 544.
What two things should you check when operating the electric fuel pump with the cold start valve?
Check if cold start valve is ejecting fuel and verify spray angle and flow rate are okay.
What system needs to be filled and bled after temperature sensor installation?
The cooling system (Group 17) needs to be filled and bled.
What special tool is needed to adjust the CO level?
Special Tool 13 1 011 is required to remove the cap and Special Tool 13 1 100 is used to adjust CO level on the air control screw in the air flow sensor.
What is the maximum tightening torque for installing the 0Â°C temperature switch?
The maximum tightening torque is 30 Nm (22 ft. lbs.).
What should you check if there are no breaks in the wiring but the current reading is incorrect?
Replace control unit and check code number and color code.
What do the numbered callouts 1 and 2 indicate in the temperature switch diagram?
Callout 1 indicates the electrical plug connection, and callout 2 indicates the temperature switch body.
What resistance value should the ohmmeter display when checking between terminal 3 and socket 13 of the diagnosis socket?
The ohmmeter should display approximately 0 ohm.
What is the minimum voltage that should be displayed on the voltmeter during the idle signal test?
The voltmeter should display at least 9 volts.
What test should be performed if the ammeter reading is not within the 400-500 mA range?
Check the flow of both wires from the control unit to the idle valve according to the wiring diagram with an ohmmeter. Eliminate any breaks, and if there are no breaks, replace the control unit.

Check fuel flow rate and spray angle.

What should happen to the resistance value after making a throttle switch adjustment?
The resistance value should rise immediately to infinity ohms after making the adjustment.
What should you do if the engine speed does not rise when the wire plug is pulled off?
Replace idle control valve and check code number and color code.

Where should you look for tightening torque specifications for the temperature sensor installation?

Use new hose clamps.

Component number 5 is the fuel level transmitter.

What components are shown in the numbered callouts (1-5) in the fuel system diagram?

What engine designation is shown at the top of this page?
