The fresh/recirculating air relays are located behind the center of the dash, as shown in Figure 3.
What should the positive voltmeter lead be connected to during the short test?
The positive lead should be connected to the terminal closest to the power source, starting near the POWER DISTRIBUTION BOX.
What components are shown in the Power Distribution Box at the top of the diagram?
The Power Distribution Box contains Relay Noise Suppressors, K1 Normal Speed Relay, K6 High Speed Relay, and K10 Wiper Control Unit.
What repair action is required if some doors unlock during Operation 3?
Repair/replace the suspect Door Lock Motor circuit.
What page reference corresponds to connector C106?
Page reference 7000-4-2.
What wire color connects from the hazard switch to the combination switch?
A .75 BR (0.75 brown) wire connects from the hazard switch to the combination switch.
How many terminals does the sunroof motor connector have?
The sunroof motor connector has 3 terminals in a vertical configuration.
Which relay is responsible for the high beam headlights?
The K3 HIGH BEAM RELAY is responsible for the high beam headlights.
What is the connector designation for the large 30-pin connector shown in the center?
The large 30-pin connector is designated as C103 with part number B300001.00.
What component should be replaced if a short to ground is not present at terminal 11?
Replace the Central Locking Control Unit.
What wire color carries the hot supply from the unloader relay K5 to the heated seat system?
A 2.5 WT/BR (white/brown) wire carries the hot supply from the unloader relay K5.
What is the page number and section title shown at the top of this diagram?
The page number is 8000-3 and the section title is "SPLICE LOCATION VIEWS - ENGINE HARNESS SPLICE LOCATIONS".
What are the four speaker positions shown in the solid state amplifier diagram?
The four speaker positions are left rear, left front, right rear, and right front.
What type of relay is shown in the on-board computer relay box?
The diagram shows a CODE relay in the on-board computer relay box.
What is the resistance value of the front crash sensors in the SRS system?
The left and right front crash sensors each have a resistance of 10K OHMS.
What should you check if both antenna resistances are correct during the antenna noise test?
Check the hood ground strap. If OK, substitute different Antenna at Radio. If good, replace Antenna. If noise is still present, refer to Noise Symptom Table.
What is the first step if all voltages are correct in the initial test?
Replace the Blower Motor
What is the connector designation for the seatbelt warning timer?
The seatbelt warning timer has connector designation B090001.05.
What position should the A/C selector switch be in during the isolation test?
The A/C selector switch should be ON (Depressed).
What page should I reference for Connector Views?
Connector Views can be found on page 8500-0.
What voltage monitoring system is connected to the solid state voltage monitor input?
The ABS Electronic Control Unit is connected to the solid state voltage monitor input via a .75 BU wire.
What ground points are labeled for the rear tail light assemblies?
Ground points G300 and S324 are shown for the rear tail light ground distribution
Where is the auto-charging flashlight connector located?
The auto-charging flashlight connector is located on the LH side of the glove box, as shown in Figure 6.
Which components receive input from the service interval processor?
The service interval printed circuit, fuel input, and vehicle speed input components receive input from the service interval processor.
What diagnostic checks should be performed if the voltages are correct in Table 1?
Proceed to Table 2. Check the wire to terminal 3 for an open. Check the wire from terminal 4 for an open to ground (see schematic).
Which splice location appears to be a connector rather than a splice based on its identifier?
C103 appears to be a connector rather than a splice, as indicated by the 'C' prefix instead of 'S'.
What year is this BMW M3 Electrical Troubleshooting Manual for?
This is the 1990 BMW M3 Electrical Troubleshooting Manual.
How many pins does the main relay have and how are they numbered?
The main relay has 9 pins numbered 1-9, arranged in a 3x3 grid configuration with pins 1, 4, 7 on the left column, pins 2, 5, 8 in the middle column, and pins 3, 6, 9 on the right column.
What important note appears at the bottom of the diagram regarding vehicle variations?
The note states 'SOME VEHICLES MAY CONTAIN AN ADDITIONAL SPLICE. (SEE GROUND DISTRIBUTION)'.
What should you do if the speaker test result is correct but there are still issues?
Check wires to the Amplifier or Radio for opens or shorts. If OK, check wires between Amplifier (if equipped) and the Radio. Remove Radio for service.
What are the two coil types shown in the starter component?
The starter contains a PULL-IN COIL and a HOLD-IN COIL.
What wire color connects from the light switch to the license plate fault indicator?
A .5 GY/WT (gray/white) wire connects from the light switch to the license plate fault indicator.
What does 'SOLID STATE' designation mean for components?
SOLID STATE designation includes only electronic parts, as indicated in the component symbols section.
Which connector has the designation B070004.00?
The connector with designation B070004.00 is C210, which shows a 7-pin single row wiring face configuration.
Which fuses are shown as HOT AT ALL TIMES in this circuit?
Fuse 21 (7.5 AMP) in the power distribution box is shown as HOT AT ALL TIMES.
What wire color connects the light switch to the instrument cluster?
A 1 GY/WT (gray/white) wire connects the light switch to the instrument cluster.
How many pins does the sunroof switch connector have?
The sunroof switch connector has 8 pins with numbered positions 1, 3, 4, 5, and 8 visible.
What control unit is shown in the power distribution box?
The K16 WIPER CONTROL UNIT is shown in the power distribution box.
What is the fuse rating for Fuse 10 in the instrument cluster printed circuit?
Fuse 10 is rated at 7.5 AMP.
What is the correct voltage reading for terminals 87 (GN/BR) and Ground when testing the Fresh/Recirculating Air Relay with the ignition switch in RUN?
Battery voltage. The correct voltage reading should be battery voltage, referenced as See 1 in the diagnosis table.
What three operational states are indicated at the top of the diagram for different circuit conditions?
The three operational states are: HOT AT ALL TIMES, HOT IN START, and HOT IN RUN OR START.
What are the required conditions for performing the Control Switch Voltage Test?
The conditions are: Ignition Switch in RUN and Blower Speed Control OFF.
What is the page reference for the Seatbelt Warning Timer component?
The Seatbelt Warning Timer references page 6131-0.
Which relay controls the oxygen sensor fuel pump?
The oxygen sensor fuel pump relay is shown in the power distribution diagram connected to the main power distribution circuit.
Where is the idle speed actuator located according to Figure 1?
The idle speed actuator is located at the top center front of the engine, as shown in Figure 1.
Where can I find the Motronic Control Unit in the vehicle?
Behind RH side of dash, above glove box.
Which figure shows the throttle switch location?
Figure 1 shows the throttle switch location at the top center front of the engine.
What relay designation is used for the fog light relay?
The fog light relay is designated as K8 FOG LIGHT RELAY.
What is the page number and section title shown in the header?
The page number is 0670-13 and the section title is POWER DISTRIBUTION with subtitle GROUND DISTRIBUTION G104 AND G200 (PARTIAL).
What wire gauge and color connects to the service interval indicator at connector C1?
1.5 GN (1.5mm green wire)
What happens when the rotary temperature control knob is rotated by more than 70Â° from its leftmost position?
When the rotary temperature control knob is rotated by more than 70Â° from the leftmost position, the hot water cut off switch opens.
What is the wire gauge specification for the connection to the Ignition Switch?
The connection to the Ignition Switch uses a 75 BR wire gauge.
What is the component designation for the ABS hydraulic unit?
The ABS hydraulic unit is designated as component C157.
What is the wire color and gauge for the connection from fuse 27 to the power distribution box?
1.5 RD/BK (1.5mm red/black wire)
What connector number is shown for the diagnostic connector?
The diagnostic connector is labeled as connector number 10.
What wire color coding is used for the ground connections in this circuit?
Ground connections use .75 BR (0.75mm brown) wire coding throughout the power mirror circuit.
What is the function of the brake switch in this Active Check Control system?
The brake switch is closed with brake pedal depressed and sends a signal to the Active Check Control unit
Is this manual specifically for the E30 M3 generation?
Yes, this is for the 1990 BMW M3, which is part of the E30 generation
What resistance reading indicates a good circuit during a continuity test?
The ohmmeter will show the resistance across that part of the circuit. A very low resistance or zero ohms indicates good continuity.
What position should the Fresh/Recirculating Air Switch be in when performing Test A for the Fresh/Recirculating Air Flap Door Motor?
RELEASED (FRESH). The Fresh/Recirculating Air Switch should be in the RELEASED (FRESH) position during this test.
In Operation 7, how do you unlock each door manually?
Unlock each of the doors by pulling up the Safety Catch Buttons.
What wire gauge is used for the connection from S541 to the G200 PARTIAL ground point?
1.5 BR (1.5 Brown)
What is the connector designation for the 6-pin rectangular connector shown in the wiring face view?
The 6-pin rectangular connector is designated as C240.
What wire colors are shown for the connections to the RH fresh/recirculating air relay?
The relay connections show 5 BR (brown), 5 WT (white), and numbered terminals 30, 87, 86, and 85.
How does the Trunk Lock operation compare to the Door Locks?
The Trunk Lock operates in a manner similar to the Door Locks.
What is the amperage rating for fuses 30 and 29 in the fog light circuit?
Both FUSE 30 and FUSE 29 are rated at 7.5 AMP.
Which fuse number controls the horn circuit?
Fuse number 7 controls the horn circuit and is rated at 15A.
Which figure shows the component locations with the splash guard pulled down?
Figure 6 shows the component locations under the LH side of the front bumper with the splash guard pulled down.
Where is the G200 PARTIAL ground point located according to the diagram?
The G200 PARTIAL ground point is located under the left side of dash, above brake pedal.
What connector should be disconnected for the Radio Power Test?
Radio connector C216 (Disconnected) or connector C215 (Disconnected).
Which splice numbers are associated with the INSTRUMENT PANEL harness?
Splices S219 and S221 are associated with the INSTRUMENT PANEL harness.
What reference is provided for additional blower control information?
SEE HEATING AND AIR CONDITIONING (BLOWER CONTROLS)
What terminal number is referenced for continuation from the top of this page?
Terminal 8 is referenced as continuing from the top of this page, as indicated by the arrow marked 'CONTINUED FROM TOP OF THIS PAGE'.
If I need to access the power windows circuit, which terminal should I check on the C302 connector?
You should check terminal Q on the C302 connector to access the power windows circuit.
What is the main component shown inside the removed steering wheel in Figure 5?
The air bag gas generator is the main component shown inside the steering wheel that has been removed from the car.
If both voltages are correct in the A/C Select Switch test, what component should you check next?
If both voltages are correct, check connections at the Evaporator Temperature Regulator.
What are the two jet heater components shown in this wiring diagram?
The diagram shows a LH JET HEATER (left jet heater) and RH JET HEATER (right jet heater).
What is the circuit section number for the power mirrors system?
The power mirrors system is documented in circuit section 5116-0.
How should the key be positioned for Operation 2?
Turn the key to UNLOCK INHIBIT (clockwise until key is horizontal).
What is the wire gauge and color for the connection going to the cigar lighter?
The wire going to the cigar lighter is 2.5 RD/YL (2.5mmÂ² Red/Yellow).
What component is found at the center of the windshield header?
The active check control unit is located at the center of the windshield header, as shown in Figure 6.
Which diagnostic references should you see for terminals 7 (GN/BR) & Ground?
See diagnostic reference 1 for terminals 7 (GN/BR) & Ground.
What type of connection is made at connector C202?
C202 is labeled as an accessory connector.
Which terminals on the air flow meter are labeled for light load and full load?
Terminal 6 is labeled for LIGHT LOAD and terminal 2 is labeled for FULL LOAD on the air flow meter.
Where is the Coolant Temperature Sensor located?
The Coolant Temperature Sensor is located on the lower RH front side of engine, on coolant manifold.
What ground point is referenced for the brake warning system?
Ground point G200 is referenced for the brake warning system connection.
How many pins are shown on the Interior Light Timer Control connector?
The Interior Light Timer Control connector (B090001.16) shows 9 pins arranged in a 3x3 grid, numbered 1-9.
Which component is connected through connector C103?
Connector C103 is connected to the chime module circuit in this power distribution diagram.
Which fuses are marked as 'NOT USED' in the power distribution box?
Fuse 25 and connector C203 are marked as 'NOT USED'.
What connector is shown for the Fresh/Recirculating Air Relay?
The Fresh/Recirculating Air Relay uses connector B090001.17, showing the mating face with pins numbered 1-9.
What wire color and gauge connects to the fuel injectors from the main relay?
The fuel injectors are connected with .75 RD/WT (0.75mm red/white) wire from the main relay.
How many pins does the Central Locking Control Unit connector have?
The Central Locking Control Unit connector has 14 pins total, arranged in two rows with 7 pins on each row (pins 1-7 on bottom, 8-14 on top).
What voltage should be measured between BU & Ground after rotating the A/C Control Panel TEMP Control to Mid-Position?
0 Volts should be measured between BU & Ground after rotating the A/C Control Panel TEMP Control to Mid-Position.
What are the main sections of the turn signal switch shown in the combination switch assembly?
The turn signal switch shows LEFT and RIGHT positions with corresponding BL (blue) and BR (brown) connections for each direction.
What should you do if AM only is weak and noisy?
Remove Radio for service.
What are the two conditions required for the Evaporator Temperature Regulator test?
The two conditions are: Ignition Switch in RUN (Engine need not be running) and A/C Selector Switch ON (Depressed).
Where is the door lock motor positioned according to Figure 4?
The door lock motor is positioned behind the panel in the lower rear of the LH door, as shown in Figure 4.
What component opens to shut off the Blower Motor if there is insufficient air flow to cool the resistors?
The Safety Switch will open, shutting the Blower Motor off until the Resistors have cooled.
What happens to the LED fault indicator after the alarm clears?
Depressing the test button will clear the alarm indicator, but the LED fault indicator remains on.
What action is required if the display shows 'CODE' and the Radio will not operate?
If display shows 'CODE' and Radio will not operate, the individual Anti-Theft Code must be entered before the 'Anti-Theft' instruction booklet.
How long does the alarm indicator flash when a fault occurs?
When a fault occurs, the alarm indicator flashes, the appropriate LED fault indicator lights, and the panel light goes on for five seconds.
What are the two ground distribution points shown in this power distribution diagram?
The two ground distribution points are G200 (PARTIAL) and G300.
What is the proper procedure for installing the clutch disc?
Place clutch disc over dowel pins. Tighten mounting bolts separately and uniformly to specified torque.
What section should you refer to for bleeding the clutch during installation?
You should refer to section 21 00 006 for bleeding the clutch.
At what gap measurement between Special Tool 21 2 060 and slave cylinder must the drive plate be replaced?
The drive plate is worn and must be replaced when there is a gap of 5 mm (0.197") between Special Tool 21 2 060 and slave cylinder.
What cross-reference is given for removing the transmission on the BMW M3?
For removing the transmission on the BMW M3, see reference 23 00 022.
What cleaning procedure should be performed on the drive plate?
Clamp drive plate on tester and clean liner with emery cloth.
What should you do with the brake fluid in the tank when removing the clutch master cylinder?
You should draw off brake fluid in tank to lower level to connection for the filling pipe.
What tool should be used to clamp the tester when checking drive plate lateral runout?
Clamp tester 21 2 110 in a vise.
What should be done with the grooved ball bearing in the crankshaft during installation?
Check grooved ball bearing in crankshaft for easy movement, replacing if necessary.
What warning is given about non-conformance during installation?
Non-conformance could cause bearing to seize on guide sleeve.
What procedure reference number covers installing an exchange transmission?
Procedure 23 00 032 covers installing exchange transmission.
What should be placed on the bolt before installation in the final step?
An insulator should be placed on the bolt before installation.
How should bolt (11) be removed?
Unscrew bolt (11) while counterholding on front of shaft.
What tool should be driven in against the stop if necessary during bearing installation?
If necessary, drive in against stop with Special Tool 24 1 060.
What should be done with bolts when installing the shift console?
Always replace bolts. Make sure consoles are horizontal to the shift console while tightening (shift lever noise).
What should you check when installing the guide sleeve components?
Check installed position of the components after removal of cap (1), spring (2) and lockpin (3).
What must be aligned when installing the sintered steel synchromesh ring for 2nd gear?
The short tabs of the synchromesh ring must be aligned in the groove of the pressure pieces when installing the sintered steel synchromesh ring.
What important safety note is mentioned regarding the turning lock?
Important! Turning lock. Opening in bearing inner race must engage in ball.
What should be checked during the installation process according to the thrust washer instruction?
Check thrust washer (1).
Which component corresponds to callout number 9?
Callout number 9 corresponds to the selector shaft.
What is the important note about the opening in the bearing inner race?
The opening in bearing inner race must engage in ball. Draw line (1) to make installation of bearing race easier.
What is the Loctite number specified for installing the collar nut?
Loctite No. 270 is specified for installing the collar nut with bolt cement.
What should be applied to the guides and bearings during installation?
Give guides (F) and bearings (L) a light coat of Molykote Longterm 2.
What reference section should be consulted for removing the guide sleeve?
For removing the guide sleeve, see section 23 11 623.
What special tool is needed to pull out the output shaft?
Special Tools 23 1 060 and 23 1 301 are needed to pull out the output shaft toward rear far enough that bearing inner race can be pulled off.
What special tool is required for pressing off the 3rd gear and operating sleeve?
Special Tool 23 1 490
What tool is labeled as 23 1 240 in the bottom image?
Tool 23 1 240 is the special tool used to drive in the radial oil seal with the sealing lip lubricated with oil.
What are available from Parts in different thicknesses for adjustment?
Circlips are available from Parts in different thicknesses.
What must be done to remove the selector shaft according to step 3?
Remove needles on selector shaft, drive out pin (3) in selector shaft while counterholding, pull out selector shaft toward rear, and remove selector arm.
How should the roller bearings be installed?
Install roller bearings with large diameter end facing out.
How do you loosen the circlip on the layshaft?
Loosen circlip with one knock from Special Tools 23 1 270 and 00 5 500.
What size wrench should be used for tightening nuts with a socket together?
Tighten nuts with a standard 17 or 19 mm wrench socket together with a torque wrench.
What important note is given about the spacer installation?
Important! Spacer. Installation: Mount guide sleeve in such a manner that oil groove is aligned with oil bore in the transmission case.
What should be done after lifting out the end cap?
Remove spring (6) and lockpin (7), then check installed position and remove backup light switch.
What must be checked when pressing on the synchromesh ring with Special Tool 23 1 290?
When pressing on, make sure that the short tabs of the synchromesh ring are aligned with the groove in the thrust pieces.
Where can information about synchromesh rings be found?
Check synchromesh rings - see 23 23 505.
What section should be referenced for bearing replacement specifications?
See section 23 21 703 for bearing replacement specifications.
What must be done to ensure proper fit when installing the needle bearing collar on the output shaft?
The collar for bearing sleeve on output shaft must protrude slightly, and if applicable, check circlip (10) for correct fit.
How is the collar oriented for the 3rd gear guide sleeve and sliding sleeve?
The guide sleeve and sliding sleeve should be installed with the long collar facing 3rd gear.
What is the recommended play adjustment between circlip and guide sleeve?
Adjust play between circlip and guide sleeve to 0...0.09 mm (0 to 0.0035 inches).
What components make up the selector arrest mechanism?
The selector arrest consists of a locking ball, spring, and detent ball as shown in the layout diagram.
What does callout number R represent in this transmission diagram?
Callout number R represents the reverse gear.
What is the proper clearance specification for the circlip and guide sleeve adjustment?
Adjust play between circlip and guide sleeve to 0 ... 0.09 mm (0 to 0.0035").
What Loctite number should be used to coat the end cover?
Loctite No. 573 should be used to coat the end cover before installation.
What is component number 2 shown in the second diagram?
Component number 2 is a holder that needs to be inserted, pressed out and secured in position.
How should the roller bearing be installed on the layshaft?
Install roller bearing on layshaft that small diameter end faces up.
What temperature should bearing inner races be heated to for installation?
Heat bearing inner races to approximately 80Â° C (175Â° F) using a hot air blower and install on layshaft, driving on to fit tight with Special Tool 23 1 440 if necessary.
What should be placed between claws and sealing surface to avoid damage when using the special tool?
To avoid damage on sealing surface, use a piece of wood, aluminum or similar material between claws and sealing surface.
What needs to be applied to the collar nut installation?
Bolt cement needs to be applied when installing the collar nut.
What should you do with the oil when removing the transmission?
Drain the oil from the transmission.
What is the first step in replacing the radial oil seal for the input shaft?
Remove guide sleeve 23 11 624 and lift out radial oil seal.
What distance does dimension B represent in the measurement example?
Dimension B represents 10.1 mm (0.398 inches), which is the distance from guide sleeve sealing surface to circlip bearing surface.
On which page would I find the layout drawing for the shift mechanism?
The layout drawing for the shift mechanism can be found on page 23-2.
What should be done with the socket head bolt before removing the special tool?
Mount selector arm with socket head bolt before removing the special tool, and install socket head bolt with a bolt cement. Tightening torque is specified.
What important note is given about transmission oil levels?
Transmissions are supplied with oil since 1.86, so that it is only necessary to check the oil level after installation of the transmission.
What special tool is referenced for driving in the radial oil seal with the part number 23 1 240?
Special Tool 23 1 240 is used for driving in the radial oil seal, as shown in the installation procedure.
What should be done with the selector rods before beginning installation procedures?
Move selector rods to neutral position and slide 3rd/4th gear selector rod through selector forks.
What tools are needed to loosen the layshaft circlip?
Special Tools 23 1 270 and 00 5 500 are needed to loosen the circlip with one knock.
What procedure is shown in the top diagram?
The top diagram shows pushing or driving on the output flange and installing the collar nut with locking compound.
What is the required axial play specification for the transmission shaft bearings?
The axial play required is 1.1 to 1.3 mm (0.043 to 0.051").
How should the ball be installed in the transmission assembly?
Insert ball (2) with grease and push on washer (1).
What must be removed before pressing off the reverse gear?
Circlip (11) must be removed before pressing off reverse gear.
What should be checked on synchromesh rings before assembling?
Check wear of synchromesh rings according to see 23 23 505 prior to assembling.
What should be checked before installing the circlip?
Check axial play of layshaft, then install circlip (2).
What gear components are specifically labeled in the transmission layout?
The labeled gear components are: Input shaft with 4th gear (5), 3rd gear (15), 2nd gear (19), 1st gear (25), Reverse gear (28), and 5th gear (33).
What is the important note about guiding the synchromesh ring?
Guide in synchromesh ring with tabs in sliding sleeve.
What component is shown in the first diagram with part numbers 23 1 200, 23 1 210, and 23 0 020?
The first diagram shows the output flange mounting assembly with the special tools needed for installation.
What procedure is required for the output shaft in the case rear section?
Remove input and output shaft assembly 23 21 504. Remove Special Tool 23 2 170 and pull off leaf spring.
What is the groove configuration for operating sleeve (3)?
Operating sleeve (3) has three grooves and is installed with shouldered end facing 3rd gear or grooves facing 4th gear.
What guide sleeve must be removed before removing the radial oil seal?
Guide sleeve 23 11 623 must be removed.
What components are removed according to callout numbers 4 and 5?
Remove snap ring (4) and remove washer (5).
What are the circlips available in according to the adjustment procedure?
Circlips (3) are available from Parts in various thicknesses for proper play adjustment.
What is the procedure number for removing and installing or sealing the cover with guide tube for clutch release?
The procedure number is 23 11 623 for removing and installing or sealing cover with guide tube for clutch release.
What procedure is covered on page 23-311?
Page 23-311 covers the procedure for replacing the radial oil seal for the output flange.
Which tool number is used for pressing second gear, bearing sleeve, third gear, synchromesh ring and guide sleeve?
Special Tool 23 2 080 is used for pressing second gear, bearing sleeve, third gear, synchromesh ring and guide sleeve with operating sleeve off of output shaft.
What should be aligned during the assembly process?
Align selector rods during the assembly process.
What is the acceptable axial play range for the layshaft through the bore for the oil filler plug?
The axial play should be 0.13 to 0.23 mm (0.005 to 0.009 inches).
What is the part number for the special tool used to mount the transmission?
The special tool part numbers are 23 0 090 and 00 1 490.
What should be applied to splines and guide pins before transmission installation?
Give splines and guide pins a light coat of Microlube GL 261 prior to installation of the transmission.
What should be done with the transmission after supporting it from underneath?
Support transmission from underneath, remove cross member (5), then lower transmission to front axle carrier.
What direction should the operating sleeve be moved and how should the guide sleeve be adjusted?
Move operating sleeve in direction of reverse gear and adjust guide sleeve with circlip (11) to take up all play.
How should the guides and bearings be coated during installation?
Coat guides (F) and bearings (L) lightly with Molykote Longterm 2.
What should you remove after taking out the 3rd/4th gear selector fork?
Remove 3rd/4th gear selector fork, loose balls.
What are the example measurement values for distances A, B, and C when measuring bearing clearances?
Distance A is 25.3 mm (0.996"), distance B is 10.1 mm (0.398"), and distance C is 14.0 mm (0.551").
What should be done with the sealing lip during installation of the radial oil seal for the output flange?
Lubricate the sealing lip with oil before installation.
What is the recommended method for completing the bearing installation after the initial pressing?
Complete the installation by driving the bearing further simultaneously with light hammer knocks, then install the circlip and reverse gear switch.
What type of manual transmission is covered in section 23?
The Getrag 240 Five Speed Manual Transmission with Overdrive is covered in section 23.
What transmission system is shown in this sectional drawing?
This is a section drawing of the shift mechanism for the GETRAG 265/6 Overdrive Transmission.
What component is labeled as number 4 in the circular gear assembly diagram?
Number 4 refers to the circlip that should be lifted out and always replaced during installation.
What is the installation orientation for guide and operating sleeves on splines?
Install guide and operating sleeves on splines with the groove facing 4th gear.
What tool is specified for tightening the threaded ring after installation?
Use Special Tool 26 1 040 to tighten the threaded ring after finishing installation.
What should be done before connecting the transmission during installation?
Engage gear before connecting transmission.
What special tool is needed to pull off the output flange?
Special Tool 33 1 150 is needed to pull off the output flange.
What special tool is needed to install the selector arm?
Special Tool 23 1 250 is required to install the selector arm.
What is the important safety note regarding circlip (5) before pressing off 1st gear?
Circlip (5) must be removed before pressing off 1st gear. Always replace circlip during installation.
What should be noted when installing the lockpin and backup light switch?
Note the arrangement of the lockpin when installing the lockpin and backup light switch.
What is the important note about the snap ring when working with 1st gear?
Snap ring (10) must be removed before pressing off 1st gear, and it should always be replaced during installation.
What should be referenced for additional information according to the footnote?
According to the footnote, the Specifications section should be referenced for additional information.
What is the important orientation requirement for thrust pieces during installation?
The stepped end of thrust pieces faces the operating sleeve, and the bevelled sides of the thrust pieces must face the operating sleeve.
What components are pulled off in step 9?
Pull off operating sleeve and fifth gear selector fork, and pull out selector rod (9) forward.
What components are numbered 2 through 6 in the shift lever assembly?
Number 2 is the circlip, 3 is the rubber ring, 4 is the washer, 5 is the snap ring, and 6 is the rubber part.
What is the function of component number 12 in this assembly?
Component number 12 is the Transmission switch.
What should you do after shifting the lever to P position during range selection lever cable adjustment?
Loosen the nut until the cable rod has cleared.
What check should be performed during installation after supporting the transmission?
Check length of bolts during installation.
What lubricant is specified for the upper and lower plates?
Molykote Longterm 2 should be used to lubricate the upper and lower plates.
What component is identified as number 1 in this shift layout diagram?
Component number 1 is the shift lever.
What special tools are needed to loosen the threaded sleeve for the shift lever?
Special Tool 26 1 060 or 26 1 040 is needed to loosen the threaded sleeve several turns.
What should be lifted out along with removing the shift lever?
The wire snap ring should be lifted out when removing the shift lever.
Which components are stacked together in the numbered sequence 24, 25, 26, and 27?
Components 24 (upper plate), 25 (spring), 26 (spacer), and 27 (circlip) are stacked together in the shift mechanism assembly.
How should the clip on the shaft bolt be disconnected?
The clip should be disconnected in the retaining tab by turning and swinging up, and it is accessible with a screwdriver.
What needs to be disconnected before removing the bolts?
The plug (2) needs to be disconnected before removing the bolts.
What is component number 15 in the shift layout drawing?
Component number 15 is the Selector lever.
What lubricant should be used during installation of the bearing sleeve and joint?
Lubricate bearing sleeve and joint with Molykote Longterm 2.
What page reference is given for the selector lever complete with base removal and installation for automatic transmission?
The page reference for selector lever complete with base removal and installation for automatic transmission is 25-16.
What component needs to be removed after disconnecting the plug and removing the bolts?
The base needs to be removed after disconnecting the plug and removing the bolts.
What should be verified about the rubber seals after finishing installation?
Check for correct seating of rubber seals after finishing installation.
What should be checked during installation regarding the transfer plate?
Check the installed direction of transfer plate and check for correct seating of rubber cover and foam rubber seal.
What dust covers need to be unclipped during the removal process?
Unclip dust cover (1) on body and dust cover (2) on shift console.
How do you install the pin on the push button according to diagram 30 25 019?
Guide pin of push button into pull rod hole.
Which component connects the shift handle to the transmission mechanism?
Component number 17, which is the Cable, connects the shift handle to the transmission mechanism.
What type of plug needs to be disconnected during this procedure?
Disconnect plug, as shown in the service step.
What type of shift console is being serviced according to the section heading?
An aluminum shift console is being serviced according to section 25 11 211.
What correction is needed for worn or seized universal joints?
Check clearance and movement, replacing propeller shaft if necessary.
How should I address worn or seized universal joints?
Check clearance and movement, replacing propeller shaft if necessary using part number 26 11 000.
What procedure must be followed to unscrew the transmission suspension?
Unscrew transmission suspension as shown in the procedure for cars with manual transmission and vibration damper on output flange.
Which image reference number shows the final installation step with the power divider cap?
The reference number is 30 26 035.
What part number identifies the propeller shaft being replaced?
The propeller shaft part number is 26 11 000 that is being removed during this procedure.
What additional step is required for 1983 and later models during propeller shaft removal?
For 1983 models and later, you must unscrew the connector in addition to the standard removal procedures.
What are the requirements for eliminating propeller shaft vibration and noise?

Requirements include elimination of disturbances from faulty engine and transmission mounts, tension in exhaust assembly, etc. The propeller shaft must be in perfect optical and mechanical condition, and if balance plates are missing or propeller shaft is suspected to have imbalance, refer to instructions supplied with balancing equipment.
What component must be slid on before pressing the center mount?
The dust guard (1) must be slid on before pressing on the center mount with Special Tool 24 1 050.
What should be replaced during installation according to the manual?
Replace stop nuts during installation.
What tool number 11 1 310 is shown in the first diagram?
Tool number 11 1 310 appears to be the mandrel used for removing the propeller shaft center.
Which special tool is used to drive in the center?
Special Tool 11 1 130 is used to drive in the center.
What special tool is required for tightening the threaded sleeve after installation?
Special Tool 26 1 040 is required for tightening the threaded sleeve after finishing installation.
What should be checked during installation after replacing the propeller shaft cap?
Check seals on propeller shaft and power divider.
When should the cap be slid on to the power divider?
Slide cap on to power divider after finishing installation.
What special tools are needed to support the transmission on cars with 4 HP 22 Automatic Transmission?
Special Tools 20 0 120 and 00 2 020 are needed to support the transmission.
Where can additional information about specifications be found?
Additional specifications information can be found in the Specifications section, as referenced at the bottom of the page.
What should be done with stop nuts during installation?
Replace stop nuts and use the tightening torque specified in the specifications section.
Where do you measure the angle on the propeller shaft rear section?
Apply the gage on the propeller shaft rear section and determine the deflection angle of the center mount, correcting with shims if necessary on the transmission suspension or center mount.
What must be removed first when servicing the spring strut coil spring?
Remove spring strut mount 31 33 001, then remove upper spring retainer with rubber ring and coil spring.
What is the critical warning about spring struts during this procedure?
Don't let spring struts tilt out or sag through, as this would damage the ball joints.
How do I correct flat spots appearing on tire treads?
Replace shock absorber.
What should be done with any remaining grease for the outer joint?
Add remaining amount of grease in joint for the outer joint.
How can you identify rubber mounts for 6 cylinder and M 3 models?
Rubber mounts for 6 cylinder and M 3 models are marked with an orange paint dot.
What tool operation is required to begin the support spring strut installation?
Unscrew nuts to begin the installation process.
What component number is shown for the lockplate installation?
Component number 30 31 506 is shown for the lockplate installation.
What important safety note is mentioned regarding the guard removal?
Remove the guard, if the inside bearing inner race remains on the stub axle after pulling off the bearing units.
What should you note about the flange replacement procedure?
Replace flange if shaft seal bearing surface on flange is scored seriously.
What is the recommended distance for unscrewing nuts and pressing the front axle final drive away from the engine oil pan?
Unscrew nuts and press front axle final drive away from engine oil pan by 10 to 15 mm (0.394 to 0.591").
What type of nuts should be replaced during installation of the front axle carrier?
Replace self-locking nuts during installation.
What should be done with the left bracket for control arm during this procedure?
Disconnect the left bracket for control arm.
What drive system configuration is specified for this wheel hub procedure?
The procedure is specified for All Wheel Drive configuration as indicated in the heading.
What type of nuts should be replaced when working with control arms?
Replace self-locking nuts when working with control arms.
What are the procedure numbers for replacing shaft seals on the left and right output shafts?
The procedure number for replacing the shaft seal on the left output shaft is 31 51 015, and for the right output shaft is 31 51 020.
What special tools are used to pull the right output shaft out of the front axle final drive?
Special Tools 31 5 011 / 012 are used to pull the right output shaft out of the front axle final drive by approximately 15 mm.
What is the bottom-most component in this shock absorber assembly?
The bottom-most component is the Screw-on ring (component 15).
Which cars require steering wheel removal according to this procedure?
Only cars with SRS (Supplemental Restraint System) require steering wheel removal, referencing Group 32.
How is the Klingelnberg gear tooth configuration described?
Klingelnberg same height along its entire length
What type of teeth does the front axle final drive use?
Gleason hypoid spiral teeth, right-hand spiral direction - code F 86 on ring gear and pinion.
What symptom indicates weak shock absorber efficiency when driving over successive rough road surfaces?
Wipping of body when passing over successive rough road surfaces
What important rule applies to the total thickness of shims (B + C)?
The total thickness of shims (B + C) must not be changed. If the thickness of shim (C) is reduced, the thickness of shim (B) must be increased by the same amount, or vice versa.
What groups should be referenced for removing the splash guard and front wheels?
Remove splash guard by referring to Group 51, and remove front wheels by referring to Group 36.
What should you do with the old grease when replacing the dust cover?
Remove the old grease by cleaning the joint.
In what increments are shims available?
Shims are available in steps of 0.05 mm (0.002").
Where can you find the tightening torque specifications referenced in this procedure?
The tightening torque specifications can be found in the Specifications section, as indicated by the asterisk and 'See Specifications' note.
What contact pattern conditions are labeled around the inner rings?
The inner rings show contact pattern load conditions including 'without backlash', 'with correct pattern', 'correct', 'turning direction', and various load conditions like 'too small', 'too large'
How is the correct shim thickness calculated?

Correct shim thickness comes from circlip thickness (e.g. 1.30 mm) plus read value (e.g. 0.30 mm) equals 1.60 mm (0.063") minus specified play of 0.02 mm (0.001") equals shim thickness of 1.58 mm (0.062").
What is the first step mentioned in the installation procedure?
The first step is to install the guard, if applicable.
What type of bearings does this procedure apply to?
This procedure applies to tapered roller bearings used in the differential assembly.
What does component 33 4 045 identify in the special tool setup?
33 4 045 is part of the special tool assembly required for the drive flange pulling operation.
What component is identified by callout number 1 in the engine mount diagram?
The engine mount turning lock is identified by callout number 1.
How should the differential be secured when pulling off the tapered roller bearings?
Clamp differential in vise fitted with aluminum jaws before pulling off both tapered roller bearings.
What is the second adjustment needed after installing new bearings?
The second adjustment needed is the backlash of ring gear.
How much should the right output shaft be pulled out of the front axle final drive?
Pull right output shaft out of front axle final drive by approximately 15 mm (0.591") with Special Tools 31 5 011/012.
How should you secure the control arm nut after installation?
Lock the nut with a cotter pin.
What important safety consideration is mentioned regarding shock absorber storage?
Always store shock absorbers in upright position. If shock absorbers are stored laying down with their piston rods moved in, this could cause a knocking noise when used in car again.
What special tools are used together to replace the lockplate and lock?
Special Tools 00 5 500 and 33 4 050 are used together to replace the lockplate and lock.
What must be replaced during the steering gear installation?
Replace the self-locking nut and replace seals during installation.
Why is it important to keep matched drive pinion and ring gear pairs together?

Drive pinion and ring gear were matched in a special machine for maximal quiet running. The pair code (P), e.g. 43, is electrically inscribed in the ring pinion and ring gear. Never install ring gear and drive pinion with different pair codes (P) together.
What should be done with the final drive oil during this procedure?
Drain final drive oil. For installation, pour in final drive oil and apply tightening torque.
How many separate procedures are referenced for this dust cover replacement?
The procedures are identical with those described in 31 60 020/021, indicating two related procedures.
What should you do if the measured gap value deviates from the nominal value?
If the measured value deviates from the nominal value, replace the rubber mount.
What page number covers the spring strut mount replacement procedure?
Page 31-15 covers the spring strut mount replacement procedure.
What distance limitation applies during the break-in period for a replaced front axle final drive?
Maximum permissible road speed during the first 1,000 km (600 miles).
What technique is recommended if the circlip doesn't engage properly during installation?
If necessary, apply knocks on Special Tool 31 5 011 with a plastic hammer to drive in shaft until circlip engages.
What is the D actual measurement in the example?
What causes the body to rise when accelerating?
Shock absorber efficiency weak (see Troubleshooting Shock Absorbers)
How do I fix a defective rubber damper on a shock absorber?
Check/replace rubber damper.
What is the first step shown in the procedure sequence?
Unscrew left and right stabilizer mounts.
What special paint marking should be installed on coil springs for four wheel drive cars?
Only install coil springs with stripes of red paint together with thick rubber rings 1 124 322.
What is the final step shown for stabilizer removal?
Disconnect left and right stabilizer mounts and remove the stabilizer.
What is component number 1 in this shock absorber assembly diagram?
Component number 1 is the Cap.
Which page contains information about the drive pinion/ring gear layout drawing?
Page 31-27 contains the drive pinion/ring gear layout drawing.
What should you refer to for cars with Electronic Absorber Control (EDC)?
For cars with Electronic Absorber Control (EDC), refer to information in Group 37.
What should be removed before starting the CV joint replacement procedure?
Remove front output shaft 31 60 000 before beginning the constant velocity joint replacement.
What component is being installed in the final step shown on the page?
The new lockplate is being installed and locked in the final step.
What should be done with the seal during the final drive removal process?
Replace the seal.
What important preparation step is mentioned for the pins and bores?
Pins and bores cleaned to remove grease.
What is the procedure number for replacing the bearing in the console for the right output shaft?
The procedure number is 31 53 050.
What components are shown in the diagram numbered 30 27 003?
The diagram shows: (1) ABS wire harness, (2) ABS control unit, (3) connection components, and (4) T-connector.
What is the first step shown in the procedure?
Disconnect exhaust assembly and suspend from car with a piece of wire.
What is the final drive ratio for this vehicle?
The final drive ratio is 3.64.
Why is it important to protect the constant velocity joint from dirt?
The constant velocity joint is not encapsulated, so it needs protection against dirt contamination during service.
What is the procedure number for replacing shaft seal for drive flange?
The procedure number is 33 11 151.
What has replaced Special Tool 33 2 113?
Special Tool 33 2 113 has been replaced by 33 2 117, and wheel bolts should be used instead.
How much should you lower the trailing arm during spring removal?
Only lower trailing arm enough that spring can be removed. Lowering too far could cause damage on output shaft joints.
What special tool should be used according to the instruction 'Use Special Tool 33 4 045'?
Special Tool 33 4 045 should be used as shown in the diagram with callout 33 4 045.
Which BMW models require Special Tool 33 4 049 for the wheel bearing procedure?
Special Tool 33 4 049 is used for 323 i, 325 e/i models and cars with ABS since 1986 models.
What is removed from convertible models according to part number 51 43 000?
Remove rear side trim panel of convertible models with part number 51 43 000.
What important caution is given regarding the trailing arm when supporting it?
Don't damage the brake line and unscrew shock absorber on trailing arm.
What type of nuts should be replaced during installation of the rubber mount?
Self-locking nuts should be replaced during installation.
What is the important step when unscrewing the trailing arm on the rear axle carrier?
First guide in bolt for inner bracket, and it's important to tighten bolts with car in normal position, then apply tightening torque.
What installation instructions are given regarding washers and nuts?
Use washers, replace self-locking nuts, and apply tightening torque according to specifications.
How many pulse wheel teeth are specified?
The number of pulse wheel teeth is 48.
What components are labeled with callouts 33 4 042 and 33 4 044 in the wheel bearing removal diagram?
Callouts 33 4 042 and 33 4 044 indicate special tools used in the wheel bearing removal process.
What is emphasized as important when tightening bolts during installation?
Tighten bolts with car in normal position, then apply the specified tightening torque.
What component is being lowered in the bottom left image?
The final drive is being lowered as shown in the bottom left image.
What should be done with stretched wire snap rings?
Replace stretched wire snap rings to prevent lateral bending of ring.
During the first 1,000 km break-in period, what is the maximum permissible speed in 4th gear?
Never faster than 2/3rds of the max. permissible speed in 4th gear (direct). For cars with a five speed manual transmission, this applies to 5th gear.
What special tool is shown being used in the middle left image with the wheel hub assembly?
Special Tool 33 4 047 is being used in the middle left image.
What type of axle is shown in this rear axle layout drawing?
This shows the 15Â° axle configuration.
What specific procedure is required for the brake pad wear indicator wires during installation?
Make sure of correct location of brake pad wear indicator wires with tab of dust cap - rubbing of the wires on the wheel rim must always be prevented!
What should be done with the pistons during installation?
Push back pistons completely during installation.
How often must brake fluid be replaced?
Brake fluid must be replaced annually.
What will happen if the sealing of the rubber ring is not perfect?
If sealing is not perfect, the building up of vacuum will be impaired.
What should be done first when installing the piston?
First pull rubber guard on to piston. Don't cant piston.
What should be checked after completing the ABS control unit replacement?
Check ABS.
What important note is given about mixing up brake lines?
Don't mix up lines (mark if necessary).
What component should you pull out along with the bulb holder during ABS indicator lamp replacement?
Pull the indicator lamp with bulb holder out of the instrument cluster.
What components are labeled A, B, and C in the spreader assembly diagram?

The diagram shows three components of the spreader assembly, but the specific identification of parts A, B, and C is not detailed in the visible text beyond the instruction to press out pin B and pull out part C.
How should the brake pad be positioned during installation?
Push brake pad toward outside completely before inserting spring.
What should I do if I find damaged caliper recesses causing uneven pad wear?
Remove and install, repair or replace calipers or wheel cylinders.
What's the correction for excessive dead travel between brake shoes and brake drums?
Adjust parking brake.
What reference section covers removing and installing the output shaft?
See Removing and Installing Output Shaft 33 21 000.
What should I do if the safety lamp reading is less than 10 ohms?
Check wires 1 and 29 for ground out, then measure between connection 86 on electronic relay plug and wire 29 on control unit plug.
What tool is recommended for drawing off brake fluid from the tank?
Use a syringe used exclusively with brake fluids.
What should you do with brake fluid when working on the ABS system?
Catch brake fluid and keep it off of clothes or painted parts.
What causes reduced parking brake efficiency according to the note?

The parking brake will not be needed during normal car operation, which consequently reduces the friction torque due to corrosion of brake drums or contamination of linings, causing the force required for operating to increase proportionally.
How do you correct seized pistons in a brake caliper?
The corrections are: a) Remove and install, repair or replace calipers, b) Check caliper installation, c) Remove and install, repair or replace calipers or wheel cylinders.
What tool is required to remove the brake disc?
A wrench socket 34 1 020 is required to remove the brake disc.
What important safety check must be performed regarding the brake pad wear indicator?
Check routing and securing of wire for brake pad wear indicator, check for secure holding with tab of dust cap, and ensure rubbing of wire on wheel rim must always be avoided.
Which procedure should be referenced for complete information about brake disc replacement?
See also SI Group 34.
What factors affect the amount of slip and frictional force according to the manual?

The amount of slip and frictional force depend chiefly on the tires (type, treads, rubber composition), the road surface (material, surface condition, wet, ice), the road speed and the slip angle of the wheels.
What section covers checking front brake disc thickness?
Front brake discs - check lateral and difference in thickness is covered in section 34-5.
What three codes should be checked when replacing a brake force regulator?
When replacing a brake force regulator, check: (1) Calendar day/year number, (2) Reduction (e.g. 0.45), and (3) Switching over pressure.
What voltage should be tested between wires 1 and 10?
The voltage between wires 1 and 10 should be tested as part of the hydraulic unit pressure build-up test.
What important note is given about replacement parts availability?
Replacement parts are not available for brake master cylinders with a recessed stop pin (ABS).
What is the component number for the ABS lamp shown in the wiring diagram?
The ABS lamp is component number 371.
What does the note about the diode in valve relay specify?
The note specifies that the diode in valve relay applies to 1988 models.
How should you keep brake line connections clean during service?
Keep open lines and connections clean by inserting plugs.
What indicates that the automatic slack control function is working properly?
Function of automatic slack control can be checked through a wheel bolt bore. This is indicated by a clicking noise on the rear wheels.
What should be checked before starting the troubleshooting procedure?
Before starting troubleshooting, turn on ignition, run engine, and ensure the battery is charged (check).
What comprehensive check is required after replacement of hydraulic components?

After replacement of the hydraulic unit, the control unit, the speed sensors and the wire harness as well as after performance of jobs which are in contact with ABS equipment, the entire antiblock system has to be checked with the BMW service tester. It is important that brake lines be routed correctly.
What causes uneven pad wear?
Wrong type of brake pads, caliper recesses dirty with caps damaged, corrosion in calipers or wheel cylinders, or rubber ring for piston control swollen.
What safety precaution must be taken when measuring resistance on the switch with wire and plug?
Ignition must be turned off while measuring.
How should the slots of the damper and filter be positioned relative to each other?
Turn slots of damper (3) and filter (4) to be offset to each other by 180Â°.
What is the maximum distance you should be able to drive with the parking brake applied before adjusting it?
You should be able to drive the car from the parking lot to the workplace max. 400 meters (1300 feet) with the parking brake applied.
What is specified regarding tightening torque for brake hose installation?
Tightening torque is specified but marked with an asterisk referring to the Specifications section.
What should you check if the brakes are excessively hot while driving?

Check for compensation bore in master cylinder clogged, no play between push rod and master cylinder piston, rubber parts swollen from contact with wrong type of brake fluid, vent hole in brake fluid tank clogged, corroded calipers, cross spring broken, or parking brake lever not released fully.
What does component 361 represent in this ABS wiring diagram?
Component 361 is the Hydraulic control unit.
What safety precaution must be taken before pulling off a plug and measuring resistance during dynamic voltage testing?
Turn off ignition before pulling off a plug and measuring resistance.
How do you address excessive dead travel in parking brake cables?
See b) - which refers to adjusting the parking brake.
What are the 17 components included in the repair kit?

The repair kit includes: (1) spring, (2) support, (3) primary cup, (4) fill-in washer, (5) intermediate piston, (6) separating cup, (7) stop sleeve, (8) spring, (9) screw, (10) push rod piston, (11) stop washer, (12) secondary cup, (13) plastic bushing, (14) circlip, (15) seal, (16) aluminum seal and (17) silicone grease.
What is the section number and procedure code for removing and installing the brake force regulator?
The section number is 34 34 100 for removing and installing brake force regulator.
What section and page number is this brake line routing diagram found on?
This diagram is found on page 34-10a of the service manual.
What test step is being performed for the control unit/simulation of rear wheels?
Test step 07 - testing voltage between wires 1 and 10 for solenoid pressure build-up drop hold.
What does component 360 represent in this wiring diagram?
Component 360 is the Electronic control unit.
How do the speed sensors detect wheel rotation?

Each speed sensor has a gear wheel, which runs past the permanently magnetized edge of the speed sensor and is installed in the wheel hub. The rotary motion of the wheels is recorded by inductive sensors and an electric signal is sent to the electronic control unit.
What is the reference number for the parking brake adjustment procedure?
The parking brake adjustment procedure reference is 34 10 014.
In the brake booster filter diagram, what do callout numbers 1, 2, 3, and 4 indicate?
Number 1 is the cap, number 2 is the holder, number 3 is the damper, and number 4 is the filter.
What is the reference number for the ABS electronic control unit procedure?
The reference number for the ABS electronic control unit remove and install/replace procedure is 34 52 510.
Where is the procedure for removing and installing the hydraulic control unit located?
The procedure for removing and installing the hydraulic control unit is located on page 34-29.
What must be done before adjusting the parking brake if the brakes have to be bled?
If brakes have to be bled, this must be done before adjusting the parking brake.
What should you do if brake lines are mixed up on the hydraulic unit?
Replace hydraulic unit.
What are the two main adjustment distances that need to be set during brake pedal installation?
Distance (A) for the brake master cylinder push rod adjustment and distance (B) for the stop light switch adjustment.
What note appears at the bottom left of the page?
The note states '* See Specifications'.
What does the retainer (1) attach to on the accelerator pedal lever?
The retainer (1) attaches to the shaft of the accelerator pedal lever and must be pulled off to slide the shaft to the left.
What should be disconnected on versions with clutch pedal return spring?
Disconnect clutch pedal return spring on body.
What component is labeled as (2) in the first diagram?
The carpet behind the accelerator pedal that needs to be pressed down.
What are the three numbered steps for removing the accelerator pedal?
1) Press off retainer on the accelerator pedal shaft, 2) Press down on carpet behind the accelerator pedal, 3) Press in clips in direction of arrow and lift out accelerator pedal upward.
What should be done to the master cylinder on pedal base during removal?
Unscrew master cylinder on pedal base.
What installation check is required for models with an over-center helper spring?
Check for correct installed position in models with an over-center helper spring, and also refer to the pedal layout drawing.
What procedure should be followed to remove the pedal before replacing bearing sleeves?
Remove pedal according to procedures outlined in sections 35 21 000 or 35 31 000.
What must be disconnected from the brake pedal?
Disconnect brake pedal return spring on pedal.
What lubrication is required for the bearing surface after drilling or reaming?
Lubricate bearing surface with grease.
What should you check on the brake caliper when mounting an M3 car wheel?
Mount an M3 car wheel carefully. Check clearance on the brake caliper (pad spring holder in the brake caliper could be damaged or displaced).
How should the dial gage be positioned when measuring rim well runout?
Apply dial gage tip on rim well, turn wheel by hand and measure max. radial runout. The dial gage must be perpendicular to the rim well.
What is the first step when mounting tires with a modern mounting machine?
Unscrew valve and deflate the tire.
What marking should be made when balancing wheels?
Paste adhesive tape or make a chalk mark, both 3 to 4 cm (0.181 to 1.575") long, on the outside of the tire being balanced, opposite the valve.
What conditions must be met for the engine during wheel balancing?
The engine must run smoothly without hesitation, doors, engine hood and trunk lid must be closed and the driver should sit in the car as still as possible.
What equipment is recommended for lifting the car during wheel balancing?
Lift car with a two-pillar hoist if applicable.
What callouts are shown in the wheel balancing diagram?
The diagram shows callouts 1 and 2, indicating different measuring support positions for the control arm end balancing procedure.
What procedure number covers checking front or rear wheel for lateral and radial runout?
Procedure 36 10 209 covers checking front or rear wheel for lateral and radial runout.
What marking indicates the outside of the tire?
The outside of the tire is marked and should be mounted on the correct side, especially in case of asymmetric tires.
What important safety note is mentioned about mounting the wheel?
Mount in same position with valve facing down to maintain proper wheel balance.
What should be done if the tire is not seated on the rim correctly during inflation?

If the tire is not seated on the rim correctly, increasing the inflation pressure will not improve the tire seating. Instead it will be necessary to press off the tire mounting, apply another coat of tire mounting paste and try to inflate the tire again.
What measuring support is required for control arm end balancing up to 5 inch rims?
Apply measuring support for balancing on control arm end (1) (up to 5" rims). Use a suitable holding fork or additional fork.
What should be done after lowering the jack during rear wheel balancing?
Lower the jack and place it underneath the differential with slight pressure.
What should be done to make joints accessible during the repair process?
Make joints accessible and drill off spot welding seam, as shown in image 30 41 529.
What action is taken after marking the cutting line?
After marking the cutting line, you cut off the cover along the marked cutting line.
What preparation is needed for the welding holes?
Drill plug spot welding holes in all mating surfaces required for plug spot welding.
What should you do after pulling off the foil?
Build up laminate to final thickness by cutting repair bandages to size, hardening and grinding inbetween as necessary.
What problem is mentioned regarding sheet metal panels and spot welding?
Sheet metal panels are too thick for perfect resistance spot welding with workshop equipment.
What diagram number shows the bottom view of the door adjustment?
Diagram 30 41 409 shows the bottom view of the door adjustment.
What areas require holes to be drilled for plug welding that are not accessible for spot welding?
Mating surfaces not accessible for spot welding require holes to be drilled for plug spot welding, which is done after lifting off the trunk floor plate.
What two operations are shown for spot welds in the diagrams?
The operations shown are to drill out spot welds and grind off welding seams.
What callout number shows the installation of the cross member with the straightening bench?
Callout number 30 41 275 shows the installation of cross member with straightening bench attachment and clamp.
What should never happen to fiberglass scrapping material?
Never let it get into drink water systems.
Where can you find information for removing the roof panel?
Refer to information on page 41 - 001.
What components should be installed and what should be checked afterward for the trunk area?
Install trunk lid and top lid. Check gaps.
What is the proper method for positioning a panel during installation?
Clamp on panel and align according to hole and seams.
What should be done with the mating surfaces on a partial replacement section?
Grind mating surfaces on partial replacement section and fit in.
What important procedure must be done to the spot welded flange on the wheel opening edge?
Cringe the spot welded flange on the wheel opening edge in the shown area.
How should you weld all reinforcements through the provided holes?
Plug spot weld all reinforcements through provided holes.
What surface preparation is required before installing the roof panel?
Straighten and grind mating surfaces. Coat blank metal parts with zinc dust paint before installing roof panel.
What adjustment might be needed if the door doesn't fit properly?
Use washers if door is too low.
What precaution should be taken regarding poisonous vapors during galvanized metal work?
Make sure of thorough extraction of poisonous vapors, as the welding smoke contains poisonous zinc oxide.
What compound should be used on all joints during assembly?
Seal all joints with a joint sealing compound.
What welding method is used for the cowl panel?
Spot weld cowl panel on cowl.
What is the first step shown in the images for preparing the connection points?
Uncover points of connection and drill off welding spots.
What should be done after finishing assembly work when die stamping?
The chassis number can also be die stamped after finishing assembly work, which requires removing the cover on the compartment wall and cover for the blower motor.
Who is the source of supply for workshop equipment and materials mentioned in this manual?
HWB (a Business Division of BMW AG) is the source of supply for workshop equipment and materials.
What additional step may be required if applicable during the repair?
If applicable, cover inside of damaged surface with the pulled off sheet and keep it stretched by applying strips of metal or plastic until hardening is finished.
What preparation is required for mating surfaces on the new B pillar?
Grind mating surfaces on new B pillar and coat mating surfaces required for spot welding with zinc dust paint.
What reference page should you consult before starting the center door pillar replacement procedure?
You should refer to information on page 41-001 before starting the procedure.
What is done to the left and right roof braces during removal?
Drill off left and right roof braces.
What should be done if necessary when installing the windshield?
If necessary, install windshield with several pieces of rubber frame.
What is the first step shown in the side panel replacement procedure?
Mount side panel and mark cutting line.
What is the purpose of applying anti-drumming compound to the wheel house?
The anti-drumming compound is sprayed out on the wheel house to reduce noise and vibration.
What is the final cutting step shown in the procedure?
Cut off side panel from tail panel and trunk side section.
What fire extinguishing agents can be used on fiberglass materials?
Fire extinguishing agents include water mist (no water stream), powders, foam, CO2 and halon.
What figure shows the brazing procedure for the entrance?
Figure 30 41 244 shows braze entrance along outside edge.
What additional welding may be required according to the final step?
Weld on reinforcement brackets if necessary.
What type of surface joints are being created in the bottom right image?
Tin mating surface joints of side panel partial replacement sections.
What is the approximate height difference the engine hood should be deeper than the side panels?
The engine hood should be approximately 1 mm (0.039") deeper than the side panels.
What measurement is given for the cutting distance below the brazed roof joint?
What is the source of supply indicated for the grease?
The source of supply for the grease is HWB.
What part number is shown for the spot weld side panel procedure?
Part number 30 41 089 is shown for the spot weld side panel procedure in trunk lid opening.
How many different repair procedures are illustrated in the diagrams?
Six different repair procedures are shown, each with its own reference number (30 41 072 through 30 41 079).
What should be done to unpainted surfaces that become exposed during adjustment?
