What is the final step if all electrical checks pass but tail lights still don't work?
Check plug connections on check control and replace check control if necessary.
What is the minimum battery voltage required for the instrument cluster simulator to be ready for use?
The red control lamp will not come on with battery voltage of < 11.5 V; the simulator is not ready for use.
What part number should be used when replacing the dimmer relay for display issues when switching on lights?
Only install a diode relay, Part No. 61 31 1 373 154.
What should you do if the stop light switch power flow and adjustment test fails?
Adjust or replace stop light switch.
How should the battery connections be made to the simulator?
Connect red terminal (3) on B + and black terminal (4) on B - of a 12 V battery. Turn on simulator with switch (1).
What resistance value should I expect for the stop light indicator circuit?
The stop light indicator circuit (pin 24) should show 4.7 ohms when measured with an ohmmeter to pin 9 (-).
Which generation of SI does not require the LED to go out in 100 meter intervals?
The LED must not go out in 100 meter intervals for final display value (Not applicable to 2nd generation SI).
How do you reset the INSPECTION display?
Long reset (9) will cancel the display. All five green LEDs come on. The time counter is not influenced! Time counter can be reset with a second reset (9).
What fasteners need to be removed to access the instrument components?
Unscrew bolts to access the instrument components.
What should you do for '3' Series Cars when testing the SI signs?
Connect printed circuit board.
What warning systems are monitored by the check control according to the diagram labels?
The check control monitors FASTEN SEAT BELTS, OXYGEN SENSOR, OVER HEAT, and AIR BAG systems.
What are the main sections covered in this checking procedure?
The procedure covers: 1) Checking Complete Instrument Cluster, 1.1) Connecting Simulator, and 1.1.1) 3 Series Cars.
What section covers the fuel level transmitter for the check or replace procedure?
Section 62 16 000 covers the fuel level transmitter for check or replace procedure, with reference to Group 16.
What page number contains information about headlights aim?
Page 63-1 contains information about headlights aim (section 63 10 004).
What tool is recommended for removing low beam lamps on 1988 models?
A hot air blower is recommended to heat the clips before lifting out the lamp.
What arrows are visible in the tail light removal diagram and what do they indicate?
Multiple arrows point to screws that need to be unscrewed to remove the tail light from the tail panel.
What are the numbered positions in the rear tail light assembly for the middle image?
Position 1 is turn signal, 2 is blank, 3 is tail light, 4 is stop light, and 5 is backup light.
What is the procedure for replacing a light bulb in the left or right front turn signal?
Unscrew the screw, take off the lens, then unscrew the light bulb in the bulb holder.
What section reference is given for removing the side radiator grill?
Section 51 13 040.
When should the freezing prevention switch be installed?
The freezing prevention switch should be installed only after installation of the evaporator.
What should you do with the nut shown in diagram 30 64 125?
Unscrew nut.
What tool is recommended for discharging the air conditioner system?
Discharge pressure in air conditioner with help of a valve core remover.
What electrical connection must be made during condenser installation?
Connect plug (1) of extra fan with plug (2) of wire harness.
What safety precaution is emphasized when disconnecting the pipes?
Insert plugs in open connections immediately after disconnecting both pipes to prevent contamination.
What part number references are shown for the charging station procedures?
The procedures show part number references including 30 64 325, 320 64 113, 30 64 099, 30 64 142, 64 52 007, and 320 64 110.
What electrical connections need to be disconnected during ventilator removal?
The plug needs to be disconnected and the relay needs to be pulled off.
What should you be careful not to do when removing the temperature switch?
Don't bend the temperature sensor when removing the temperature switch and pulling the temperature sensor out of the housing.
What should be checked after installing the heater?
Discharge, charge and check air conditioner for leaks after installation.
Which tray should be removed and what is its part number?
Remove and install tray 51 16 200.
Where are the footwell flaps positioned in this assembly?
The footwell flaps are component number 9, positioned in the lower section of the heating and air conditioning assembly.
What should be checked during installation according to the upper right diagram instructions?
Check rubber mount (4), replacing if necessary.
What should be done to remove the control panel?
Unscrew screws and pull out control panel slightly.
What section of the manual covers heating and air conditioning?
Section 64 covers Heating and Air Conditioning.
What connector needs to be removed and where is it located?
Remove connector (1) on left side between heater (3) and rear area heater duct (2).
What does callout number 2 point to in the air conditioner checking procedure?
Callout number 2 points to the valve core remover on the low pressure side of the air conditioner.
What component is shown being removed with foam rubber cover (1)?
The foam rubber cover (1) is being removed from what appears to be part of the HVAC system housing.
Which diagram shows the bolt that needs to be unscrewed on cars with radio?
Diagram 30 64 185 shows the bolt (1) that needs to be unscrewed on cars with radio.
What must be done to the cooling system during heater removal?
Drain coolant and disconnect both water hoses.
Which components must be removed before accessing the freezing prevention switch?
The tray (51 16 200) and the instrument panel trim on the left side (51 45 130) must be removed.
What alternative method can be used for discharging and charging the air conditioner?

The air conditioner can also be discharged and charged with only one charging hose (high or low pressure). However, working with a valve core remover and two charging hoses will speed up discharging and charging procedures.
What component is number 11 and where is it located on the charging station?
Number 11 is the vacuum pump, located at the bottom of the charging station.
Which component is labeled as number 8 in the diagram?
Component number 8 is the heater core.
What is the final step for cable removal?
Pull out clamp (1), disconnect cable (2) on lever (3) and remove.
What must you check during installation according to the middle right section?
Check code number (1) and tightening torque.
What are the different pressure gauges shown on this charging station?
The charging station has a low pressure gauge (number 3), pressure gauge for charging pressure (number 20), and pressure gauge for high pressure (number 21).
What conditions indicate the air conditioner does not have moisture or leaks?
If the pressure does not rise, the air conditioner does not have moisture or leaks.
What are the first two steps when beginning the footwell ventilation cable replacement?
Disconnect battery ground lead, then remove and install instrument panel trim at left 51 45 180.
What components need to be removed to access the air conditioning compressor?
Remove air cleaner, disconnect plugs (1), unscrew nut (2), and disconnect hose (3).
Which charging hose connects to the low pressure side of the air conditioner?
The blue charging hose (1) connects on the low pressure side (thick pipe) of the air conditioner.
What is the function of component 10 according to the diagram?
Component 10 is the bypass flap motor.
What is the safety warning regarding pressure gauge operation?
Never leave high pressure on pressure gauge (2) during the operating procedures - danger of destruction.
What should be checked during installation regarding the sleeve?
Make sure sleeve (1) has perfect fit in body wall.
What does connection number 7 represent in the wire harness explanations?
Connection number 7 is the connection for the clutch switch.
What is replaced together with the plastic cable during telescope replacement?
Telescope is replaced together with the plastic cable.
What is the procedure for removing the front spoiler on models since 9/85?
Unscrew front spoiler screws in left and right front wheel houses.
How should speaker wires be routed during installation?
Route speaker wires from the front along standard wire harness to the place of speaker installation.
What is component number 5 in the sound system?
Component number 5 is the Speaker balance control, located along the right side of the vehicle.
Where should the extra wire harness from the installation kit be routed?
Route the extra wire harness from the installation kit from the driver's side via center console to the place of control unit installation.
What component covers the speaker in the installed assembly?
The speaker mask (component 2) covers the speaker in the installed assembly.
What step involves connecting the antenna wire?
Connect the antenna wire and route the wire harness between the trim panel and side panel.
What are the first steps to begin removing the radio?
Lift out the radio mask or remove the radio completely.
What step follows unscrewing the bolts in the removal procedure?
After unscrewing bolts, lift the instrument carrier out of the instrument panel and pull off all plugs.
What type of screws are used to mount the holder, and what additional hardware is included?
M 5 x 15 screws are used along with spring washers and nuts to mount the holder.
What type of testing setup is shown in the bottom diagram?
The bottom diagram shows testing on a disconnected central plug using test clips on windows (1) for troubleshooting purposes.
Where can specifications be found according to the note at the bottom of the page?
Specifications can be found in Group 62 according to the note at the bottom of the page.
What is the page range for power antenna installation procedures?
Power antenna installation procedures are covered on pages 65-151, under procedure code 65 22 005.
If the driving range function is wrong, what components should I check?
Coding plug, reserve volume balance, speed signal, consumption signal, and fuel level transmitter/reserve contact.
What should the voltmeter display when connected to the proper connections?
The voltmeter should display voltage when connected to the proper connections.
What happens when holding the lever in the CONSTANT position?
Car accelerates until desired road speed is reached; release lever. Reached road speed is maintained and stored in memory.
What size screw is specified for mounting the ground strap?
Mount ground strap on ground point with a M 6 x 10 screw.
What components are numbered 1 and 2 in the stop light switch adjustment diagram?
Component (1) is the adjustment nut and component (2) is the lock nut used for setting the stop light switch position.
What section number covers Radio and Special Equipment in the manual?
Section 65 covers Radio and Special Equipment.
How do cassettes come out of the player once the buttons are pushed?
The cassettes slide out after the white push buttons unlock the cassette holders.
What occurs when pulling the lever to CALL position?
The control unit accelerates car to a previously stored road speed when lever is pulled in CALL direction.
What are the four antenna wire connection types listed for the radio installation?
1 = Automatic antenna, 2 = Radio antenna jack, 3 = Connection on radio for automatic antenna (white wire), 4 = Special equipment connection (red wire).
What components need to be inserted when installing the plug-in antenna?
Insert the sealing grommet (1), mount the antenna with holder (3) and bolts (4), and mount the ground wire with bolt (2).
On which pages can I find air temperature sensor service procedures?
Air temperature sensor removal and installation procedures are on pages 65-361.
Why should tape be used in the area of the hole during installation?
To avoid damaging paint finish with burrs from drilling and to provide a better method of marking the location of the hole.
What special care should be taken after drilling the hole?
Pull off tape carefully toward hole to avoid taking off paint on edge of hole, deburr hole's edges and coat edges with zinc dust paint.
How do you remove the backrest after unscrew the bolts?
Unscrew the left and right bolts, then pull up and remove the backrest.
What should you do before connecting the voltmeter to test the control unit voltage?
Pull off plug on control unit and turn on ignition.
Where should you look for additional specifications related to the coding plug?
See Specifications section as noted with an asterisk.
What voltage should the voltmeter display when testing wire (5) on the disconnected control unit plug with ignition on?
The voltmeter should display about 0 volt.
In the diagram showing cable installation, what do callouts 1, 2, and 3 indicate?
Callout 1 indicates the cable, callout 2 indicates the holders, and callout 3 indicates the spring retainer.
What is the first step for removing the rear seat backrest?
Lift out the seat cushion first. For cars with the bolted version, pull off covers and unscrew bolts on left and right sides.
How do you insert a cassette into the radio console?
Place the cassette insert in the console as shown in the diagram.
What reference number is associated with the coding plug replacement procedure?
The reference number is 733 62 019.
What should I check if the ignition lock from position R display board background button lighting is not working with lights on?
Check for a break in wire at term. 31 g, term. R, term. 58 power supply missing, or lights in BC II defective.
What is the first step in removing the rear seat cushion and backrest?
Remove rear seat cushion and backrest - 52 20 000.
What tool is mentioned for pressing in the holders during installation?
A screwdriver is used to press in holders between beaded edge and panel on left and right sides.
What steps are involved in removing the cap and accessing the bolts?
Pull off cap and unscrew bolts.
On which page are wind deflector installation instructions provided?
Wind deflector installation instructions are provided on page 72-120.
What is the page reference for seat belt inspection procedures?
Seat belt inspection procedures are found on page 72-115.
What installation requirement is specified for the centering pin?
During installation, the centering pin engages in bore, and tightening torque specifications should be followed.
What important note is provided about final screw tightening?
Note: Tighten screws uniformly after driving car approx. 100 km (60 miles).
If the reel produces rolling and squeaking noise when fastening and taking off the seat belt, does this affect operation?
Rolling and squeaking noise does not influence the locking function of the reel.
What condition should the window be in when unscrewing the screws?
Window opened.
How do I test if the spring pressure properly ejects the belt insert when operating the PRESS button?
Press the PRESS button while the seat belt is fastened and check if spring pressure ejects the belt insert out of the lock.
What component is labeled as item 1 in the seat belt mechanism diagram?
Item 1 indicates a deformed slide that has to be replaced.
How many numbered callouts are shown on the car diagram?
There are 16 numbered callouts on the car diagram, numbered from 1 to 16.
On which page can I find information about body cavity sealing for the entire car?
Body cavity sealing for the entire car can be found on page 97-1.
What needs to be checked regarding paint finish before sealing?
Check car for paint finish damage and damage from flying stones and, if applicable, repair after consulting the customer.

Avoid injections and pricks from high voltage during compression control. Therefore, disconnect the main relay.

maggiore di 8 V
What is the minimum resistance value for the variable fuel switching test in cycle 13?
minore di 10 Î©

Without cat: 1 684 463 124 / with cat: 1 684 463 128

min. c. 1000 cmÂ³/30s

Cat refers to Catalyst models, indicating components that are only present on vehicles equipped with catalytic converters.

What is the dogleg 5-speed?
The dogleg 5-speed for the BMW E30 320is is Dogleg 5-speed .

The 25% limited slip diff for the BMW E30 320is is 25% Limited Slip Diff .
Where is the oxygen sensor located in the system?
The oxygen sensor is located in the exhaust system, positioned near the ignition coil and thermo-time switch area as shown in the lower left portion of the diagram.
